loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58-years-old and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Virginia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Virginia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Linh would like to take a further loan to buy a larger quantity of oil-fired wood to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy oil-fired wood to sell.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en: Hieu would like to take out a further loan to buy more chicken and rice to make food to sell from her stall. Hieu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase better quality chicken and rice at competitive prices.

loans.name: Benjamin's Group

texts.en:
Nasambu is a group of three group leader farmers in Chwele District, with Benjamin selected as the Kiva representative. Benjamin has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 32 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but they will be receiving an average loan of KES 5,349 (shillings).
							
Benjamin is 34 years old and has been a farmer for four years. Benjamin works as a farmer to provide for his three children. The community and other farmers know Benjamin as friendly, hard-working, and trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups, such as the men's group. Benjamin described his harvest last year as excellent, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.							

Benjamin first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Benjamin joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and to earn enough money to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member. 

Benjamin plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, to save for the future, and to buy a pig. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Benjamin’s own life was improved because he was able to save money and feed the family. 
 							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with small-holder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Benjamin and the Nasambu Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Hoi

texts.en: Hoi is requesting a new loan to buy food and beverages to sell to her customers. Hoi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy products like food and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Rene Alfonso

texts.es:
Rene de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta 5º grado, ya que su madre no pudo continuar apoyándolo, porque solo ella lo crio, debido a que su padre los abandono. Así que, él inicio a trabajar a la edad de 14 años. Ahora tiene once años de estar acompañado, su esposa se dedica al quehacer del hogar y tienen tres hijos de 11, 6 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, de los cuales 2 asisten a la escuela.

Rene ha realizado dos  tipos de trabajo, a la edad de 14 años, inicio a trabajar de ayudante de albañilería, ahí estuvo 5 años laborando en esa actividad. Luego se inicio en la actividad de comercio, gracias a que un amigo le dijo que lo acompañara para que aprendiera, la forma en comercializar ropa y electrodomésticos.  Ahora, Rene es comerciante independiente, inicia las labores a las 6.30 de la mañana y regresa a su casa a las 3.30 de la tarde. 


El préstamo sera utilizado, para continuar en el negocio de las ventas, específicamente Rene tiene planificado invertir en la compra útiles escolares, ya que esta próximo el inicio del año escolar y las ventas de estos se incrementan en esta época.

Rene tiene el sueño de mejorar su casa, para tener mas comodidad junto a su familia, también desea ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida, pero sabe que esto lo conseguirá solo con su trabajo y esfuerzo, para sus hijos desea lo mejor y reconoce que la mejor herencia que pudiera dejarles es el estudio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a apoyarlos en todo momento, para que se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Rene is 33 years old.  He studied 5th grade because his mother was not able to support him any further as she was raising him on her own since his father abandoned them.  He started working at the age of 14.  He has now been married for eleven years.  His wife is a homemaker, and they have three children aged 11, 6 and 3, of which two are in school.  

Rene has worked in two types of jobs.  At the age of 14, he started working as a mason's assistant, where he worked for 5 years.  He then started working in business because a friend told him to accompany him so he could learn how to sell clothing and household appliances.  Now, Rene is an independent businessman, working from 6:30am and leaving for home at 3:30pm.  

This loan will allow him to continue his business, more specifically, Rene plans to use this loan to purchase school supplies as the school year is about to begin and the demand for these items in high this season.  Rene dreams of renovating his home so his family can be more comfortable.  He also hopes to be able to offer them a better quality of life, which he knows is only possible though hard work and effort.  He wishes the best for his children and knows that the best thing he can leave them is an education, which is why he is committed to supporting them always so they can succeed academically.

loans.use: purchase school supplies as the school year is about to begin and the demand for these items in high this season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase products for her store.

loans.name: Asiheeri

texts.en:
Asiheeri is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi of the Hioma region in Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, 4 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Asiheeri has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells general house hold items. 

To help expand his business, Asiheeri has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to boost his business by buying more household items. This will help Asiheeri to generate greater profits and to pay his childrens' school fees. Asiheeri hopes that, in the future, he will be able to increase projects on his land. 

Asiheeri is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Asiheeri who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: boost her business by buying more household items

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana Maria vive en la casa de sus Padres en la zona 16 de Febrero de la ciudad de El Alto. Ana Maria trabaja en el municipio de El Alto, estudia por las noches en la universidad de el Alto.
Ana Maria  necesita el crédito para compra de un equipo de computacion. Asi poder culminar sus estudios con mayor rendicion dentro de su carrera.

El sueño de Ana Maria es ejercer una profesión y subsistir en un ambiente cada vez más competitivo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Maria lives in her parents' house in the 16th of February zone of El Alto city. She works in El Alto municipality and studies at night in the University of El Alto.

Ana Maria needs a loan to purchase a set of computer equipment. This will enable her to complete university studies and perform better during her career.

Ana Maria's dream is to exercise a profession and survive in an ambience that is ever more competitive, and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a computer to use in her university studies.

loans.name: Maricarr

texts.en: Maricarr has made a living through the operation of a retail business, selling a variety of food products in the community. She has been doing this for more than ten years earning well for the family's needs.  She also has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used as additional capital for her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve, for use in future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is 29-years-old.  He lives with his wife and child in a rented house in Gaza.
 
He has been selling sport clothes since 2011.  He works hard to support his family to provide good living conditions.  Yousef is asking Ryada for this youth loan to buy shelves and decorations for his shop.  This will help him to display the clothes for the clients properly and give a good view at his shop.

Yousef is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy shelves and decorations for his shop.

loans.name: Ángela Viviana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 2 hijas de 9 y 2 años, el mayor estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Ángela  es una ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo el cual  se dedica al comercio, vende frutas y verduras y realiza fletes, él tiene un carro en el cual realiza fletes a comerciantes que compran y venden fruta y el también realiza esta actividad por su cuenta, por lo cual requiere de los créditos para comprar estos productos los mismos que luego lleva a entregara a comerciantes en los mercados de ciudades cercanas.  Su esposo recién lleva un mes en el comercio ya que antes solo se dedicaba a sus fletes pero ahora con los créditos y este negocio están mejorando sus ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, plátano y repuestos para el carro. Está desde el inicio en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha dado la institución y por la oportunidad para apoyar a su esposo en el negocio. Sus sueños son que le vaya bien en el negocio a su marido.
texts.en:
The Esperanze Nueva lending group meets every 15 days in the city of Tosagua.  Tosagua is known as a very dynamic place where the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.  Ángela, who is 31 years old, lives in this city.  She is married and has 2 daughters who are ages 9 and 2.  The eldest daughter is in school and her husband is a businessman.  

Ángela is a housewife who has sought this loan for her husband's business where he sells fruits and vegetables, and makes deliveries.  He has a car that he uses to make the deliveries to other businesses that buy and sell fruit, an activity that he also does on his own, which is why he needs this loan to purchase said products which he will then sell to other merchants in the markets of neighboring cities.  Her husband has been in this business for only a months.  Before this, he focused solely on deliveries, but now with the loans and this new business, their income has improved.  

This loan will be used to purchase fruits, plantains and car parts.  She has been a member of the group since its inception and she appreciates the help that the institution has given her, as well as the opportunity to support her husband in his business.  Her dream is that her husband's business is successful.

loans.use: purchase fruits, plantains and car parts.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards. It enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a new loan in the amount of KSH 20,000. Her new loan funds will allow her to buy a stock of fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. 

She thanks Yehu and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is widowed and has a seafood vending business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more seafood to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 21 years now.

Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to sell

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha is requesting a new loan to buy household items, food and beverages. Ha's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao is requesting a new loan to buy food and soft drinks to sell at her store. Dao's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and better quality materials. Phuong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and better quality materials.

loans.name: Luz Mila

texts.es:
Luz  mila es una mujer madre soltera, de los hijos se siente bendecida ya que ellos son la motivación para salir adelante.
Desde su corta edad siempre ha deseado superarse profesional y personalmente; al trascurrir de los años por diversas razones tuvo que aplazar los estudios,  razón por la cual se sentía triste, poco a poco y con gran esfuerzo y las bendiciones de dios logro iniciar los estudios en cosmetología y estética, motivo por el cual ella se  siente suprema mente entusiasmada  ya que gracias a eso ve el sueño realizado; el propósito o  plan al culminar   su preparación estudiantil es montar un centro de estética en el cual pueda poner en práctica todos los conocimientos adquiridos durante su tránsito  académico.

Gracias al crecimiento y la adquisición de nuevos experiencias  se ha planteado  una gran meta  y aspiración en la cual se ven reflejada la  competencia que se transmite a diario en la fundación universitaria campo alto, lo cual le permite como estudiante  plantear y organizar un futuro con una visión de innovación y calidad atreves de la cual  se lograra  una vida optima y edificante.
Al querer  ser beneficiaria del convenio kiva  ella ve una oportunidad económica de ahorrar o invertir ese dinero en el implemento de estudio, formando a si una ayuda para ella y los  hijos.
texts.en:
Luz  Mila is a single mother. She feels blessed having her children and they are her motivation for getting ahead. Since she was young she has desired to excel professionally and personally. With the passing of the years she had to put off her studies for various reasons which made her feel sad. With a lot of effort and the blessings of God she managed to start her studies in Cosmetics and Beauty. This has made her extremely enthused as she is fulfilling a dream.

Her plan on graduating is to open a beauty center where she can put into practice all the knowledge she acquired while studying. Thanks to the growth and her experiences she has formed a great goal in which you can see the competence which is transmitted daily at Campo Alto University. This permits her as a student to plan and organize a future with a vision  of innovation and quality with which she can achieve a superior and gratifying life. Being a beneficiary of a KIva loan gives her the economic opportunity to save and invest this money in the tool of study, helping her and her children.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Angie

texts.es:
Ella es Angie Daniela, Estudia auxiliar contable, porque los números significan manejar una parte muy importante de la economía de la empresa, del país y del movimiento financiero de cada uno. 
El conocimiento que ha adquirido en este técnico ha sido  muy significativo en la  vida de ella ya que le apasiona todo lo relacionado con el área administrativa y contable, y encaminar el futuro en este campo de esta manera contribuir al desarrollo financiero.
Espero en el proceso de prácticas demostrar todo el conocimiento adquirido durante la etapa lectiva  y obtener toda aquella experiencia que contribuya a perfeccionar todo lo que conlleva a un auxiliar contable competente.
Espera con la ayuda de kiva poder ser una gran contadora y terminar satisfactoriamente el estudio.
texts.en: Meet Angie Daniela. She is studying to be an accounting assistant, because numbers drive an important part of the economy of a company, the country and the financial direction of both. The knowledge acquired in this trade has been very significant in her life as she loves every thing related to accounting and business administration. Taking this path she will be able to contribute to the country's financial development in the future. She hopes that in the course of their practicums to demonstrate all the knowledge they gained in the classroom stage and gain all the experience that will make her a competent assistant accountant. She hopes that with the help of Kiva to become a great accountant and satisfactorily complete her studies.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase drinks, cigarettes, purified water, and toothpaste to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Noerm's Group

texts.en:
Noerm, 38, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she is married with two children. The family’s main sources of income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 10 years. Low crop yield is still a main challenge for her family’s business. 
Noerm has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back the loans, which has helped her relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Noerm is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Nisorei Group

texts.en:
Running a family is such a big burden for Lhingneineng, who also takes care of her father-in-law, who is going through an intensive medical treatment. She is the profiled member for Nisorei Group and she is pictured with her hand raised. She and her husband work to generate income for the family.  Before the pharmacy business was started, she raised chickens and sold them in the village and the neighbouring villages.

All the group members reside in a village which is about 40 kms north of the Imphal capital in Manipur. They are all hard-working and determined to give the best to their family and kids.

Lhingneineng runs a drug store in the town market, about 40 kms from the town capital. She sells all first aid kits and other drugs. The absence of good hospitals and doctors gives her a good chance to sell drugs in the town. The hospital in town is far away and doctors in the town are unavailable most of the time when needed. The villagers first choice is to purchase drugs from Lhingneineng's drug store and treat the patient before they are brought to the town. Keeping this in mind, she purchases and sells drugs which are meant for common illnesses like cough, fever, diarrhea, etc. She usually gets the supplies from Imphal town and sells them with a little profit. The generated income is meager and is insufficient for the family expenses and kids' education.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more drugs and sell them. With the festive season in full swing, there are so many occasions for feasts, people tend to get diarrhea and have indigestion issues with the winter approaching. She wants to purchase drugs for the treatment of those problems and make more income. Her future plan is to extend her pharmacy and become one of the well-known drug sellers in the town. She also wants to give the best education to her kids and let them appear for the allied services. She says “Thank you so much, Kiva” for the wonderful assistance and making her burden lighter. She wishes to continue the partnership and says “let us all hope for the best”.

The rest of the group members are engaged in tailoring, weaving, vegetable selling, rice selling, piggery, a cosmetic store, and paan-dukan.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for the pharmacy, generating more income and supporting the family.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita raises her two children with a simple living. She is a vendor while her spouse is a farmer. Angelita is now asking for additional capital of PHP 3,000 which will be used in her small business. She will buy more vegetables and fish to sell. Someday she hopes to earn more funds to invest to improve her small retail business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for her postgraduate education.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia has run her general store for more than 10 years to earn her living. Her business is successful enough to allow her to sustain her family's needs, and she has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to improve the business. She is always trying to find ways to augment the family's standard of living.

She is requesting a new loan in order to buy a variety of grocery goods to offer for sale. 

Her goal is to see her children become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Melna

texts.en:
Melna is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari -sari or variety store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her area.
Melna is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. Through this, she will be able to improve her store, thus attracting more buyers and customers. 
In the future, Melna hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Marybeth

texts.en:
Marybeth manages her own cafeteria to earn an income. She has been engaged in her business for many years. She earns enough to significantly supplement her husband's income and help support the family. 

Marybeth joined GDMPC in order to request a loan to buy raw ingredients with which to cook. She plans to expand her cafeteria so that she can offer a comfortable eating place to her customers. 

In the future, Marybeth intends to become more successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients with which to cook meals to serve in her cafeteria

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 28 years old and a married man who lives in the village of Sadguri Metekhi, Kaspi district. He has his wife, mother, sister and his grandmother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. Merab's mother is a stylist and generates 400 GEL monthly. His sister is a sales lady and works for a low salary. Merab also is employed, working as an artisan in a vulcanization, but his income is hardly enough to pay all the daily costs for his family.

 A loan of 1000 GEL will be a huge support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to repair his own car and start up a taxi business. Merab will serve people from his district in his spare time and will increase his income. Merab sought for credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The start-up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved to get a loan under the framework of this program. Merab will be thankful to all the lenders for helping him provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: To repair his car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 34 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Rosalie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, age 34, runs a general store business to earn an income. She has been engaged in her enterprise for five years. She and her husband have five children, four of whom attend school. She works hard to provide for them.

Ruth is requesting a PhP 14,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like shampoo, soap, milk, and canned goods to offer for sale.

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, soap, milk, and canned goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Lydia who is a farmer living in Ndaragwa with her family of three children.  She has practiced farming for 20 years where she produces and sells milk and eggs, but what she enjoys most in farming is when her poultry produces eggs.  Her greatest challenge is not being able to access feed for the poultry.
Lydia decided to go for a Juhudi Kilimo loan because they offer good services, their loans are affordable, and the loan officers deliver the loan to the client's doorstep.  During the training, she learned how to develop a culture of saving.  This loan will enable her to purchase more poultry which will bring in more income to her.  This will enable her to pay school fees for her children comfortably and also improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hair relaxer, hair cream, and weaves for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, fish and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Doris Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doris de 39 años de edad, estudio unicamente hasta 7º grado, ya que su padre falleció y su madre no pudo seguirla apoyando para que terminara sus estudios, puesto que su madre la llevaba a que le ayudara a trabajar. Su esposo, es agricultor.  De sus hijos 3 hijos, unicamente la menor vive con ella y estudia 5º  grado. 

Doris tiene 18 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa,  pero hace un año inicio en el negocio propio,  de venta de verduras y frutas. Ambos negocios los conoce muy bien, ya que cuando su padre murió, fue su madre quien le enseño a como poder trabajar en estos negocios, así fue como aprendió las técnicas de comercializar los productos. Los lugares donde ella vende están a una distancia de cinco kilómetros. Viaja en autobús, todos los días se levanta a las 4.30 de la mañana, para arreglarle el desayuno a su esposo y a su hija, después sale a vender y regresa hasta las 3.00 de la tarde a su casa.

El préstamo sera utilizado, para construir el muro perimetral del terreno donde esta ubicada su casa. De esta forma se estará ayudando a que Doris pueda comprar los materiales para la construcción y a la vez, cancelar los gastos de mano de obra. De esta forma tendrían una mayor seguridad y a la vez mas comodidad, puesto que nadie tendrá acceso directo a la vivienda.

Doris tiene muchos sueños, uno de ellos es poder dejarles donde vivir a sus hijos. También le gustaría poseer una pequeña tienda en su casa. Ademas, quisiera poder comprarle un molino a su hijo, para que trabaje en un negocio propio. Las ganancias de su negocio las utilizara, para cancelar el crédito e invertirlo en el mismo, a modo de que la fuente de empleo siempre este activa.
texts.en:
Doris is 39 years old and only reached 7th grade due to the death of her father and her mother not being able to support her through the end of her education and needed her help with work.  Her husband works in agriculture.  Of her three children, only the youngest daughter lives with them, she is in 5th grade.  Doris has worked selling clothing for the past 18 years, but a year ago she started her own business selling fruits and vegetables.  She knows both businesses well because after her father died, her mother taught her how to work in both fields, which is how she learned how to sell products.  

The places where she sells are 5 kilometers away.  She travels by bus; everyday she wakes up at 4:30am in order to prepare breakfast for her husband and daughters.  She then goes out to sell, and returns home at 3pm.

This loan will be used to build a wall around their home's property.  The loan will help Doris purchase the construction materials and pay for the labor.  The wall will provide them with better security and peace of mind as no one will have direct access to their home.  

Doris has many dreams, one of which is to be able to leave her children with a place to live.  She would also like to have a small store in her home.  In addition, she would like to purchase a mill for her son so he can have his own business.  She will use the earnings from her business to pay off the loan and invest it back into the business, so she can always have an active source of employment.

loans.use: build a wall around the perimeter of the property where her house is.

loans.name: Ouy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Ouy is aged 24 years old. She is a grocery seller and she also raises pigs to earn additional income. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 73,000 KHR per day to support her family.

This is the third loan for Ouy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. Ouy is going to use her portion to buy piglets and use a portion of the loan to spend on buying grocery items to resell. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Ulmas

texts.ru:
Улмас – активный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Живет в сельской местности, в далёком от города кишлаке. Из-за обстоятельств в семье и трудных времён он не смог получить высшее образование. Трудился с самого детство, помогал отцу. Отец его воспитал по принципу «одному мужчине мало  сорок профессий». Таким образом, Улмас  занимается разновидным  трудом и зарабатывает на жизнь, не выбирая и не деля «дело» на всякие категории.
Он также занимается скотоводством. В основном разводит, откармливает и продаёт КРС и МРС. Его родители и братья живут вместе с ним.
 Он планирует купить КРС и корм для них, но не имеет достаточную сумму на руках.  Улмас решил обратиться МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. Очень надеется найти решения своих задач приобретённым кредитом. Заранее благодарит «Арванд» за содействие и помощь.
texts.en: Ulmas is an active and hardworking young man.  He lives in a rural area, in a village, far away from the city.  Due to family circumstances and hard times, he could not obtain a higher education.  He has worked hard right from childhood, helping his father.  His father raised him according to this principal - "forty professions are not enough for one man."  This is how Ulmas is involved in various work and earns a living without choosing and dividing "business" into different categories.  He is also involved in animal husbandry.  He primarily breeds, fattens up and sells cattle and small livestock.  His parents and brothers live with him.  He plans to buy cattle and feed for them, but does not have a sufficient amount of money on hand.  Ulmas decided to come to MDO "Arvand" for a loan.  He hopes very much to find solutions for his problems with the obtained loan.  He thanks "Arvand" in advance for the assistance and help.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en:
Chen is 35 years old, widowed and has two children. To make a living, she has been selling grocery items and raising pigs. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 53,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs. 
Chen has been with VisionFund for six loans. She is now leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her pigs so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for raising

loans.name: Geovani Alexander

texts.es:
Geovani de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, ya que sus padres no pudieron seguirle ayudando para que continuara los estudios. Hace cinco años se caso, su esposa se dedica a cuidar a su pequeña hija  de tres años y a los quehaceres del hogar. 

Geovani a sido una persona trabajadora, desde la edad de 14 años asistía a los cañales a realizar trabajos de campo tales como: abonar, cortar malezas y ahoyar. Hace cinco años desde que se caso, inicio a trabajar en la venta de pan francés, se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para iniciar con la repartición del producto, termina la jornada a las nueve de la mañana, a eso de las tres de la tarde inicia nuevamente la segunda jornada del día, para concluir con esta a las cinco y media de la tarde.


El préstamo sera utilizado, para terminar la construcción de su casa y poder comprar los materiales siguientes: lamina, polines, puertas y ventanas. El préstamo sera de gran ayuda para Geovani, porque tendrá finalizada su casa y podrá mudarse junto con su familia.

El sueño de Geovani es tener un negocio, el cual ayude a mejorar los ingresos para su familia, con lo cual podría beneficiarle, para mejorar la calidad de vida de ambos. También, esta planificando seguir con los estudios de educación media, los fines de semana, así podrá optar a mejores oportunidades de empleo. Desea lo mejor para su familia, es por eso que todos los días, se levanta con la mejor disposición de realizar sus actividades diarias de la mejor manera posible, para que nunca les falte lo necesario.
texts.en:
24 year old Geovani studied until 9th grade as his parents couldn't keep helping him to continue in school. He has been married for 5 years and his wife looks after their little daughter and their home. 
Geovani has been a hardworking person: since the age of 14 he has worked in the cane fields doing farm work such as fertilizing, removing weeds, and land clearance. 4 years ago, when he got married, he started working selling french bread. He gets up at 4 in the morning to start delivering bread and finishes at 9 in morning. Then at 3 in the afternoon he starts the second shift, finishing this at half past five in the afternoon.
He will use the loan to finish building his house and to buy the following materials: laminated sheets, joists, doors, and windows. The loan will be of great help to Geovani because he will be able to finish his house and move in with his family. 
Geovani's dream is to have a business that would help to improve the family's income which would help them to improve their quality of life. He is also planning to continue with his secondary education at the weekends as this would give him better work opportunities. He wants the best for his family and this is why he gets up everyday with the desire to do his work in the best way possible so that they never lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy laminated sheets, joists, doors, and windows to finish building his house.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es: María Fernanda es una niña, la segunda de la familia, de vivienda estrato 2, graduada en un colegio distrital, comenzó la carrera técnica de administración de empresas, en la cual duro 1 solo semestre, ya que no contaba con los recursos económicos suficientes, consiguió trabajo en un call center en cobranza buscando la manera de reunir el dinero que le hacía falta para conseguir el propósito de culminar los estudios, en ese trabajo duro 2 meses, pues la salud no le favoreció, duro 7 meses sin hacer nada, a la casa llego un folleto de estudios técnicos con la opción de estudiar técnico en administración hotelera y turística en otra institución, se matriculo y estudio por 4 meses, viendo por mes una materia diferente, protocolo, etiqueta, servicio al cliente, mesa y bar, muy feliz y entusiasmada se involucraba mas en el mundo hotelero, llamándole la atención saber todo lo que podía conocer y aprender gracias a esta carrera. Lastimosamente como la vez pasada la economía no le permitía continuar los estudios, por cosas de la vida consiguió trabajo en almacenes éxito en la sección de comidas preparadas, sin pensarlo esto la impulsaría mas al mundo hotelero y gastronómico, gracias al servicio al cliente y conocimientos varios que adquirió, después de 2 años en la compañía decidió continuar los estudios de hotelería y busco información en campo alto, pues por referencias cercanas decidió estudiar allí, a pesar de las facilidades de pago le sigue quedando un poco complicado pagar todo lo que piden, pero las ganas de seguir con los estudios pueden mas ya que crecerá profesional y personalmente conociendo muy a fondo el mundo hotelero llegándose a convertir en una excelente y ejemplar gerente de hotel 5 estrellas, y porque no, crear la propia línea hotelera, ella espera que con la ayuda de kiva ella pueda culminar loss estudios en campo alto.
texts.en:
Maria Fernandina is the 2nd daughter of a family from Estrato 2. She graduated from a district school and began to study the technical career of business administration. But this lasted for just 1 semester, since she lacked sufficient economic resources. Maria then went to work in a call center in collections, seeking a means of saving money to pursue her goal of completing her education. 

She performed this job for 2 months, then her health failed and 7 months passed without work. Then a brochure arrived at her house suggesting the option of technical studies in hotel administration and tourism at another institution. She enrolled and studied for 4 months, pursuing different subjects – protocol, etiquette, client services, table and bar service. She was very happy and enthusiastic and was drawn into the hotel world, desiring to learn all she could about this career.

Unfortunately, as time passed, the economy didn't permit her to continue her studies. Life necessities required her to work in a grocery store in food preparation, without thought of continuing. After 2 years working for this company, Maria decided to continue her studies in hotel matters at Campo Alto, where local contacts recommended she attend.

Despite an improved financial situation, paying school bills was still a bit complicated. But Maria desired to continue studying in order to advance professionally and personally. She wanted to understand the hotel world, becoming an excellent and exemplary manager of a 5 star hotel – even to create her own hotel chain – and she hopes that with Kiva's help, she can complete her studies at Campo Alto.

loans.use: to pay a semester's matriculation fees in hotel management.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Ella es margarita, es madre de una niña, lleva en el programa de auxiliar de enfermería 1 año, le ha sentido el gusto y cree que ha tomado la mejor decision con el programa que escogió, desea terminar los estudios ya que quiere un buen futuro para ella y para su hija, le ha gustado la carrera porque cada vez se siente mas identificada con el, ya que desde que empezó le llama la atención todos los temas que ha visto, a de mas quiere seguir progresando en la carrera ya que espera que pueda ser una jefe de enfermera para a si poder seguir progresando por si le va bien en la carrera, quiere poder hacer en la universidad para poder ser doctora en pediatría, desea el convenio con kiva ya que como es madre soltera y menor de edad aun no tiene una oportunidad laboral, porque vive con la mama y es vendedora y gana el salario mínimo, la mama es la que responde por ella y por la hija que tiene,a demás de todos los gastos que tiene la mama en la casa.
La verdad ella no quiere dejar el sueño por el dinero, espera le puedan colaborar, ella agradecería sinceramente
texts.en:
Meet Margarita. She is the mother of a child. She has been in the Nursing Aide Program for one year. She is happy and feels that she made the best choice of programs. She wants to finish her studies as she wants a good future for her and her daughter. 

She likes this career and feels more and more attached to it. From the beginning she has been attracted to all the subjects they have studied and she wants to continue in the field. She would like to be a head nurse. If she can continue to progress and things go well in her career she would like to study pediatrics at university.

She would like a loan from Kiva as she is a single mother who is still a minor who has not had the chance to work yet. She lives with her mother who is a salesperson who makes a minimum wage. Her mother is the person responsible for her and her child and for her own expenses. The truth is Margarita doesn't want to abandon her dream. She hopes people can help her and she is sincerely grateful.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она в течение многих лет не имела источника дохода. Рано теперь хочет открыть свой бизнес. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация деловых женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. С такой целью она построила магазин. Теперь ей необходимо купить товар. Ее муж помогает ей открыть бизнес. Рано запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки продуктов питания. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Rano is a happy woman.  She is married and raising 4 children.  She did not have a source of income for many years.  Rano now wants to open her own business.  She completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women," and received a certificate.  She wants to organize a business of reselling food products.  She built a store to achieve this goal.  Rano is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy food products.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to start a new business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with two school-going kids. She operates a business selling clothing from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma lives with her family in a rental house with electricity but no running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Her greatest business challenge is the lack of capital to expand. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Fatuma is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bales of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Filomeno

texts.es:
Filomeno y su esposa viven en casa propia con sus 4 hijos en la zona San felipe de Seke de la ciudad de El Alto, Filomeno trabaja como maestro albañil en la ciudad de el alto.
Filomeno necesita el crédito para poder refaccionar su vivienda y poder brindar a sus hijos un mejor lugar para poder vivir. Comprará materiales como estuco, arena,ladrillos y se ahorrará la mano de obra.

El sueño de Filomeno es poder brindar a sus hijos el sustento y educación suficiente para que puedan ejercer una profesión, subsistir en un ambiente cada vez más competitivo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Filomeno and his wife live in their own home with their four children in the San Felipe de Seke zone of El Alto.  Filomeno works as a master bricklayer in El Alto.
Filomeno needs the loan to be able to repair his house and offer his children a better place to live.  He will purchase materials like plaster, sand and brick, and he will save up for the labor costs. 

Filomeno's hope is to provide his children with sufficient foundation and education for them to be able to practice a profession and survive in an ever more competitive environment and therefore improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, plaster, and sand to repair his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dishware in order to develop her new business

loans.name: Punku Mayor De Maras Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PUNKU MAYOR DE MARAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Maras, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dolores  ella es casada y tiene 67 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras,la socia vende cebollas,zanahorias,tomates,pepinos y entre otras verduras,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras como cebollas,zanahorias,tomates y pepinos.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank Punku Mayor de Maras. This bank is located in the district of Maras which is in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 
One member is Dolores, who is married and 67 years old and has 3 children. She works in her business selling vegetables. She sells onions, carrots, tomatoes, cucumbers, and other vegetables. She works from 8:00am until 4:00pm. She has been doing this for 7 years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her vegetables. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. 
The other members work in agriculture, selling grains, running a grocery store, and selling animals.
The member is grateful to the people who are part of her dream through this loan and promises to make her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots tomates, and cucumbers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married, and she helps her husband to earn income with her general store. She has been selling assorted groceries in their community to earn a living. 

She had joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan from its microfinance to buy additional grocery goods for sale. 

She is hopeful enough to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman and a mother of two young children, ages 6 and 2. She lives with her family in Bohol, Philippines. Emily earns an income through her cosmetic sales.

Emily is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like perfume, cosmetics, toiletries and other items. Through this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more products to her customers. 

Emily hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like perfume, cosmetics, toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулу 29 лет, замужем, и в таком молодом возрасте у Айсулу 4 дочки: Алие-9 лет, Аделе -9 лет, Назик -3 года, Алине-2 года. У Айсулу - средне-специальное образование, она домохозяйка, занимается домашним хозяйством и воспитанием детей. По характеру очень пунктуальная, ответственная, добродушная, аккуратная. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айсулу занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 35,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 4 лошади, а также в наделе имеется 4,0 ГА земли на котором ежегодно сажают картофель и зерновые культуры. Имеются все условия по содержанию скота. Супруг активно помогает по хозяйству, также в качестве дополнительных доходов супруг оказывает услуги грузовых перевозок. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсулу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айсулу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства улучшение благосостояния своей семьи.
texts.en: Aisuluu is 29 years old and married. Even though she is young, she has four daughters: Alie and Adele are nine, Nazik is three, and Aline is two. Aisuluu has a high school education and is a homemaker. She takes care of the household and raises the children. She is very diligent, responsible, kind and careful by nature. Aisuluu raises livestock and plants crops to provide the main source of income for her family. She began nine years ago when she bought cattle for 35,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Aisuluu now has four dairy cows, four horses, and four hectares of land for planting potatoes and grains every year. She has everything she needs to take care of the livestock. Her spouse actively helps on the farm and earns additional income providing shipping transportation services. Their monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her farm, Aisuluu asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy more cows. Aisuluu plans to use the profits to invest in more livestock and to save money to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia helps her husband work their farm to make a living. She also raises pigs to sell to earn more income for the family. She had joined GDMPC  recently and took out a loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She always finds ways to augment their living and is thankful to GDMPC for leading small entrepreneurs toward success. Virginia wants to improve their living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Safania's Group

texts.en:
Tumaini is a group of eight farmers in Kakamega North District, with Safania selected as the Kiva representative. Safania has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 96 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant one quarter acre of maize and one quarter acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings.							

Safania is 74 years old and has been a farmer for 50. Safania works as a farmer to provide for his 10 children. The community and other farmers know Safania as friendly, hardworking, and trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, and prayer group. Safania described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Safania joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Safania joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer, hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed family.  Because he is an active community member, wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Safania has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Safania's life because he has more profits from harvest, more farm training, and more farm group support. He also was able to save money and feed his family. In the future, Safania hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, buy a cow, and invest in a business.
 
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Safania and the Tumaini Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

Please note that there are four additional group leaders in this photo that will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy sacks of coconuts for resale. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mizeituni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mado, qui lève la main,  est une commerçante, présidente du groupe d’affaires «Mizeituni», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 41 ans et mère de 6 enfants, qui 5 étudient et 1 autre qui est encore gosse. La cliente est une vendeuse de sorghos. Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile devant son enclos, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Son conjoint est du personnel soignant (Infirmier). Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 4 sacs de sorghos. Dans le futur, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile de conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Mado is a businesswoman, who is raising her hand in the picture, is president and member of the "Mizeitun" business group and a dynamic entrepreneur. She is a 41-year-old mother of six children, five of which currently attend school, the one remaining child still being an infant. This client sells sorghum. She sets up her merchandise outside her property, where she knew she would attract customers. Her spouse works in the medical profession as a nurse. She started her business with capital given to her by her husband. Later, she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been running this business for two years. This new loan will allow her to buy four sacks of sorghum. In the future, she wishes to buy a plot of land, send her children to school and feed them. 
Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the work they do to liberate women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the established banking system, especially during this difficult post-conflict era in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of sorghum

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for 25 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 66-year-old established farmer living in the Ndaragwa area of Central Kenya. He is married and has eight children. He has been farming for 30 years, producing and selling milk, eggs and vegetables. He enjoys farming, especially growing and selling vegetables. His major challenge is due to seasonal changes and lack of water due to drought.
Charles chose Juhudi Kilimo because it offers a grace period on loans at a low interest rate. He was also encouraged by the testimonies of other farmers who have benefited from these loans. This loan will enable him to purchase water pipes to channel irrigation water to the farm during dry seasons.This will really help him produce and sell more.

loans.use: For purchasing water pipes.

loans.name: Eustina

texts.en:
Eustina is a hard-working woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Eustina wants to purchase fruits, potatoes, cassava, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, potatoes, cassava, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Erlinda de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 7º grado gracias a la ayuda que sus padres, desgraciadamente su papá falleció y tubo que iniciar a apoyar a su madre, para que en su casa no faltara los ingresos para los gastos del hogar. Ahora esta acompañada, su esposo es agricultor, tienen 2 hijos de 5 y 6 años de edad respectivamente, quienes este año asistirán a la escuela.

Erlinda es agricultora de toda la vida, desde que su padre falleció, inicio junto con su madre a cultivar maíz y frijol, así pudieron asegurar estos granos para que en su casa no hiciera falta la dieta diaria. Hace 10 años se caso y junto a su esposo siembran 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz. El terreno esta ubicado a un kilómetro de su casa y realizan el recorrido en bicicleta, para iniciar con las labores a las seis y media de la mañana y concluir la jornada a las once y media.


El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar una vaca, con la cual cada año esperan que se vaya reproduciendo para ir aumentando el numero de animales.


El sueño de toda la vida, de Erlinda ha sido tener un pequeño hato de vacas lecheras, ya que fue el sueño de su padre y desgraciadamente no lo pudo lograr; pero ella espera conseguirlo y así iniciar el negocio en la ganadería, también desea tener una yunta de bueyes, para realizar las labores agrícolas con tracción animal. Otro ideal, es que sus hijos lleguen a ser personas de bien y para esto que mejor que darles un buen ejemplo de vida y lo mas importante la educación.
texts.en:
34 year old Erlinda studied until the 7th grade, thanks to help from her parents. Sadly, her father died and she had to start helping her mother so that the family wouldn't lack the income to pay the household expenses. Now she is married and her husband is a farmer. They have 2 children who are 5 and 6 years old and will go to school this year.
Erlinda has been a farmer all her life since her father died. She began with her mother, growing corn and beans. Growing these grains meant that they never lacked for food at home. She got married 10 years ago and, together with her husband, sows 14,000 square meters of corn. The land is located a kilometer away from their house and they make the journey by bicycle to start work at 6:30 in the morning and finish at 11:30.
This loan will be used to buy a cow which they hope to breed every year in order to grow their number of animals. 
Erlinda's lifelong dream has been to have a little herd of milk cows as this was her father's dream and, sadly, he could not achieve it. But she hopes to get there and to start a livestock business. She also wants to have a team of oxen so she can do farm work with animal traction. Another hope is that her children become good people and for this she needs to give them a good example and, most importantly, education.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari, to expand her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years to earn an income. Her customers are primarily women in her community. She is unmarried and lives with her child in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. Her child attends school.

Eunice decided to join Yehu in order to access financial support to improve her business. With the Kshs 25,000 loan she has requested, she will purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners for her salon.

Eunice dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en: Soy, 44, lives in a rural area in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Soy is a married mother of six children, three of whom are dependent and still in school. To make a living, she has been growing rice while her husband is a paid worker to supplement the family’s income. Having been in this business for 10 years, Soy is able to earn about 34,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Soy has been with VisionFund for one loan. She completely paid back the loan, which has helped her better support her family with enough food. Now, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, Soy is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income in her business.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio vive en la casa de sus Padres en la zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto. Marco Antonio  trabaja como ayudante de un taller mecánico, por las noches estudia mecánica automotriz  en un instituto de la ciudad de el alto.
Marco Antonio necesita el crédito para compra de una laptop. Así podrá culminar sus estudios con mayor facilidad en el instituto donde estudia.

El sueño de Marco Antonio es ejercer una profesión y tener un taller mecánico propio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio lives in his parents’ house in the Villa Cooperativa area of the city of El Alto.  Marco Antonio works as an assistant in a mechanic’s shop.  In the evenings, he studies automotive mechanics at an institute in the city of El Alto.

Marco Antonio needs the loan to buy a laptop.  This way he will be able to complete his studies more easily at the institute where he is studying.

Marco Antonio’s dream is to practice a profession and to have his own mechanic's shop.  This way he will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to facilitate his automotive mechanics studies.

loans.name: Lirije

texts.en:
Lirije is a 53-year-old lady who lives in a very rural village of south-central Albania. It is in the region's tradition that married women dress up in a long skirt and pants at the same time, just like Lirije, yet only in the villages. She is a mother of three children.

Lirije is requesting a loan for the first time to add goats from a good breed to her existing herd. For about 10 years now, she has been selling dairy products to the farmers’ market. Here it is what she said at the interview with the loan officer: “Since birth we were trained to do this type of activity and nothing else. We are not aware of anything else, but livestock/agriculture. Knowing nothing else, we are happy with what we do.”

loans.use: to add some goats from a good breed to the existing herd

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro y su esposa viven en casa propia con sus 3 hijos en la zona Alto de la Alianza de la ciudad de El Alto, Alejandro trabaja como chofer en una empresa de la misma ciudad, su esposa trabaja como barredor en otra empresa tambien de la misma ciudad.
Alejandro necesita el crédito para poder refaccionar su vivienda y poder brindar a sus hijos un mejor lugar para poder vivir. Debe comprar ladrillos, estuco, cemento, arena y otros materiales.

El sueño de Alejandro es poder brindar a sus hijos el sustento y educación suficiente para que puedan ejercer una profesión subsistir en un ambiente cada vez más competitivo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandro and his wife live in their own house with their three children.  They live in the Alto de la Alianza area in the city of El Alto.  Alejandro works as a driver for a company in the same city.  His wife works as a sweeper for another company, which is also in the same city.

Alejandro needs the loan to be able to repair his house and to be able to give his children a better place to live.  He needs to buy bricks, plaster, cement, sand, and other materials.

Alejandro’s dream is to be able to provide his children with support and enough education so that they are able to practice a profession.  He wants this so that they are able to survive in an atmosphere that is more and more competitive.  This way they will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, plaster, cement, sand, and other materials in order to repair his house.

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.es: Floridalma de 44 años de edad se dedica desde hace 2 años a la crianza de pollos,  tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, Floridalma esta solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos y asi pode seguir con su trabajo ya que esa su única fuente de trabajo y asi ella y su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Floridalma, age 44, has been raising chickens for two years.  She has a lot of customers who prefer her for the good prices.  With what she gets from her sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her child.

Floridalma is requesting a loan from Integral to be able to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for the chickens.  This way she will be able to continue with her work because this is her only source of work.  This way she and her family will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for the chickens.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: El señor Alexander, desde hace mas de 5 años tiene su propio negocio, junto a su esposa a luchado por salir adelante, la actividad comercial de Alexander es la venta de Ropa. el credito lo solicita para invertir en el negocio comprando, Blusas, Camisas, ropa interior para damas y caballeron, ropa escolares, gracias a las ganancias adquiridad a podido mejorar su vivienda y asi le da a sus hijos las condiciones necesarios en el hogar, Agradece el apoyo que ha recibido de Kiva y Afodenic con estos financiamientos que le han otorgado.
texts.en:
Alexander has had his own business for more than five years. Together with his wife he has fought to get ahead. Alexander's business activity is the sale of clothing. The loan he is requesting is for investing in his business, to purchase blouses, shirts, and underwear for women and men, and school clothing. Thanks to his earnings he has been able to improve his house and therefore give his children the necessary conditions at home.

He is grateful for the support he has received from Kiva and AFODENIC with these funds they have given him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and clothing

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 41 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos,  ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Maria is 41 years old, is a single mother, and lives in a home of her own with her two children.  She has a store where she sells primary needs items such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other things and has been doing this for many years, which allows her to have better sales.  Her store is in her home and is very well known by the residents in the area.  She has many customers because she has a very well stocked store, but wants to invest more into it, so she is asking for a loan to buy what she needs for her store.  She is sure that she will be able to pay off the debt and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 30-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. For the past five years, she has been in the business of selling milk, which comes from her one cow, one buffalo, and four goats. She provides a valuable service in her community by selling milk to many of her neighbors, as well as butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. She also purchases goats and sheep and sells them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha. Her sons help her with her business, as does her husband, who is a school teacher. 

Shagufta is in her second loan cycle and she has a strong association with BRAC Pakistan. She has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase one more buffalo, to increase the production capacity of her milk business. She wishes to use part of the revenue for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Guzal

texts.ru: Гузал родилась в 1982 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Гузал планирует открыть свой бизнес. Она хочет открыть продуктовый магазин возле своего дома. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Гузал должна сделать косметический ремонт помещения, а также купить продукты питания как мука, макарон, сахар и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Guzal was born in 1982.  She is married and raising two children.  Guzal plans to open her own business.  She wants to open a food market near her house.  To achieve this goal, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and received a certificate.  Guzal has make cosmetic repairs of the space and also buy food products, such as flour, pasta, sugar, etc.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to make repairs to her food market and buy food products

loans.name: Oyimkhol

texts.ru: Ойимхол молодая и энергичная женщина. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем и вместе со своей семьей живет на северной части Таджикистана. Ойимхол имеет «золотые руки». Она очень умело шьет национальные женские платья. Ойимхол более 4 года занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Ойимхол имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Ойимхол хочет купить мебель для своего домохозяйства, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Oyimkhol is a young and energetic woman.  She is 20 years old.  She is not married and lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan.  Oyimkhol has "golden hands."  She masterfully sews women's national dresses.  Oyimkhol has been involved in providing seamstress services for over 4 years.  She provides her services at home.  Oyimkhol has an additional income from animal husbandry.  Oyimkhol wants to purchase furniture for her home, but does not have money.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars to purchase furniture.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of selling leso (women’s wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase twenty pieces of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pieces of lesos (women's wraps) for resale.

loans.name: Erabella

texts.en:
Erabella runs a sari-sari (variety store) retail business to earn an income. She sells various household goods and food items to members of her community. She also runs a small farm where she grows rice. She and her husband have five children and live in Corella, Bohol.
 
Erabella is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her farm, as well as canned goods, beverages, soap, and toiletries to sell in her store. With the expected profits generated from this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm as well as her store.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm, as well as canned goods, beverages, soap, and toiletries to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more salt, onions, rice, oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Choern's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Choern is a 48-year-old widowed mother of two children. The main source of family income comes from rice farming and growing sesame. To supplement the family’s income, she also sells grocery items. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years, and is able to earn about KHR 39,000 to support her family. 

Choern has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Choern will use her portion to buy sesame seeds for sesame planting and use a portion for harvesting rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income, in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sesame seeds for sesame planting and to harvest rice.

loans.name: Damaris Merari

texts.es:
Damaris es una mujer muy trabajadora de 24 años de edad, actualmente vive con su compañero de vida que se dedica a la albañilería y con su hijo de 8 años de edad.


Damaris, actualmente se encuentra trabajando en un supermercado y también se dedica a la venta de ropa, siendo su madre la que le ayuda a vender cuando esta trabajando. Esta actividad la ha heredado de sus madre, ya que tiene una venta de ropa desde hace 10 años y gracias a ella tiene la experiencia en las ventas.


Con el crédito se  le estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda invertir en mas productos como: blusas, camisas, pantalones, short y ropa interior, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y así poder darle una mejor educación y alimentación a sus  futuros hijos.


Damaris, quiere tener un negocio de ropa muy fuerte en la zona, ya que la venta es muy buena y desea dejarle una buena enseñanza a su hijo para que sea trabajador.
texts.en: Damaris is a very hard-working woman who is 24 years old.  She lives with her life partner, who is a bricklayer, and with her eight-year-old son.  Damaris works in a supermarket, and also sells clothing.  Her mother helps her with her clothing sales while she is at work.  Damaris learned this activity from her mother, who has been selling clothing for 10 years, and thanks to her she has sales experience.  The loan will help her to invest in more products, such as: blouses, shirts, pants, shorts and underwear.
