texts.es: Rosa de 52 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, desde hace 5 años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior ya que posee gran demanda por parte de muchas personas, con lo que podrá adquirir en diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52 years old, lives with her spouse and their two children.  She works selling underwear for men and women.  She has been doing this for the past 5 years, and she has many steady customers, which help her to keep the business afloat.  With the earnings from her sales, she is able to cover some of the household expenses.

Rosa is seeking a loan that will allow her to purchase larger quantities of underwear because she has a lot of demand from many people.  This will allow her to sell different styles, colors, and priced items, which will increase the number of customers she has and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase larger quantities of underwear for women and men.

loans.name: Yousif

texts.en:
Yousif is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and his four children, in Gaza. They live in a rented house,

He has been working in the painting and gypsum drywall trade. He has had a good experience. He works hard, to support his family and to provide good living conditions for his children’s future. He wants them to have a better life than his life.

Yousif asked Ryada for this youth loan, which he will use to buy templates for gypsum work, and work tools like paint rollers, brushes and colors. Yousif is very grateful to everyone who will help him to achieve success in his business, with this loan.

loans.use: to buy templates for gypsum work, and work tools like paint rollers, brushes and colors.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a 25-year-old Lebanese single woman. She has worked since 2011 selling stamps and sculptures designed to be offered as gifts on special occasions. 

Bernadette is a young ambitious woman always seeking the best. 

Today, she is very excited to borrow a youth loan form Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase items and tools needed very urgently, as she has a deadline to meet to deliver customers their requested orders. 

Bernadette trusts that receiving the wanted funds from Kiva will unquestionably ease her operations and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase items and tools needed

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married with two children, who are both in school. She has no additional family members. 

Maria sells green bananas and charcoal at the market, on a retail basis. She has been in this business for two years; she works seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and also to  educate her children up to university.  

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but no access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married with five school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mejumaa has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors, and she dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is single with six children; two go to school. She has two additional family members (mother and father). 

She operates a restaurant at the market; she sells her food to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for three years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy green bananas, rice, flour, sweet potatoes, and beef. 

Her major business challenges include transportation, defaulters, and seasonality. She is aspiring to buy a fridge to start selling cold drinks, and also to own a fully stocked restaurant.  

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas, rice, flour, sweet potatoes, and beef

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Ayant ouvert  sa cantine il y a tout juste 1 an, madame Fatou vient pour la première fois solliciter un petit crédit pour renforcer  son activité. Activité qu’elle fait pour s’occuper un peu et éviter la sédentarité. Avec cela, elle va acheter des condiments : de l’oignon, du poivre, du piment, des épices, de l’ail…pour remplir sa cantine. Elle n’est active que le matin de 8h à 13h et l’après midi est réservée à la gestion de sa maison et de ses enfants. Fatou n’a pas de charges car c’est son mari qui s’occupe de la famille.
Comme elle est à ses débuts, elle veut toujours améliorer son commerce dans le temps.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou has a stall where she sells various food products. She started this business only a year ago, and she is seeking for the first time a small loan to strengthen her activity, which keeps her busy and active. She plans to buy condiments such as onions, peppers, spices, garlic, etc. to stock up on merchandise for her stall. She works from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM, and she spends the rest of the day running her household and taking care of her children. 

Fatou doesn’t have any particular expenses, as her husband is the one who provides for their family. 

Being a novice in this activity, she wants to see her business improve consistently over time.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice,onions, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Tatiana Rocio

texts.es:
Tatiana tiene 23 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene un hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Tatiana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos,semillas, urea, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando, le gusta mucho festejar las fiestas del patrono del recinto.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 23 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has children. She lives with her husband and children in the area of Desvió De los Amarillos, part of the Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos province. She belongs to the PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES communcal bank which is located in the same area. The people here earn a living through agriculture and livestock.

Tatiana earns a living by farming corn and raising corralled animals such as chickens and pigs. With this loan, she will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizers, manure, seeds, urea, insecticides to prevent infestations and diseases, and animal feed. The purchases will be made in Ventanas city. 

Tatiana's dream is to buy land to continue farming. She enjoys celebrating during the holidays for the area's patron saint.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, urea, insecticides to prevent infestations and diseases, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  vive con su compañero de vida y su hija. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde  reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; la clienta es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, y seguir con su negocio ya que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en: The client lives with her life partner and her daughter.  She owns a tortilla bakery which is very well known in the community where she lives.  She has lots of customers since she sells the best tortillas - hot, with the quickest service, and at truly affordable prices.  The client is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead.  She has a winning attitude which is how she always stays ahead of the competition.  She thinks that when one wants something, one should know that there are risks, and that is why life is worth it.  She wants to take a risk to be able to grow her business, so she requested a loan from INTEGRAL with which to buy corn in bulk and continue with her business.  This will allow her to provide economic security for her household and a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes shop business, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Mwanasiti is requesting KES 25,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has been operating a beauty saloon business. Her potential customers are neighbors and town dwellers. She dreams of incorporating her business into a beauty training school. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Halima wants to purchase hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoos. She joined Yehu because of their favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoos for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clean cooking gas packages to sell to her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clean Liquefied Petroleum Gas to reduce cooking time and reliance on charcoal

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been running a business making leather bags for many years with the support of her husband, also shown in the photo. 

She makes bags in different sizes and sells them in her community and at the local market. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality bags and earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. Uzma is a motivated mother of two children and desires to provide them with good quality food, education, and clothing. 

To improve her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 45,000 PKR. The loan amount will be used to purchase leather in different colors, spools of thread, and needles to cater to more customers without delay. 

She hopes to increase her sales which ultimately will help with generating more income. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use a part of the profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase leather in different colors, spools of thread, and needles.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 45-year-old married woman running a business selling milk with her husband, also shown in the photo. They have been running this business together for many years.

They have two cows and sell the milk, along with butter and cheese that they make, to many of their neighbors. Khalida looks after the cows and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells the products in different places on a daily basis. They are happily working together to support their family.  

Khalida and her husband need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and education. In order to increase profits, Khalida requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy one more cow. The loan will help them increase their sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Adeela

texts.en: Adeela is a 20-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels at her stitching work. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if only her husband works for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household with the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet her increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Adeela hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her children a good education through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 50-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for many years. She has five calves and two cows for milking. Salma sells the milk and butter to many of her neighbors. 

Her business is good enough to enable her to lead a decent life. She has two daughters and one son; all are school-aged. Salma is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses. 

It’s her eighth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with their support. Now, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. 

She hopes to increase milk sales which will ultimately help her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been running a food stall in her community; she sells various food items such as ‘Tikka Kebab’(a dish of sliced meat cooked on a skewer), samosas and pakoras (fried pastry). She is expert in making them and earns sufficient income to contribute to the family income. In order to increase her sales she needs to purchase a stock of oil, salt and spices. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en: Kellen is a 35-year-old married lady with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a stall where she sells fresh food products; she also farms in order to boost her income. She is facing the challenge of variable weather; however, she has a vision of buying another plot of land and improving her standard of living. Kellen has asked for a loan to buy fresh food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh food products to sell.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San José se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 y 8 años de edad, ambos viven en su casa el menor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es maestro de una escuela local. 
Doña María  es una muy buena madre y esposa que le gusta trabajar para ganar algo por el bienestar de su familia, ella desde hace 18 años y con la ayuda del primer crédito que recibió de la institución se hizo cargo del bar en una escuela de la localidad, allí ella prepara todos tipo de bocadillos como: empanadas, panes de almidón, corviches, arroz con pollo, además de jugos de frutas naturales, todo lo que ella prepara es muy saludable para que sus pequeños tengan un alimento saludable. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, maní, frutas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
El Grupo De Crédito San José meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo. This place is known for its beautiful beaches along the coast of this gorgeous place. Here most of the people are very hardworking and work the seas.

In this place lives Maria. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children with her husband, 19 and 8 years old, both of whom live at home. The youngest is studying in school. Her husband is a teacher at a local school.

Maria is a very good mother and wife and likes to work in order to earn something for the benefit of her family. For more than 18 years, and with the help of the first loan she received from the institution, she became in charge of the food stand at a local school. There she prepares all types of snacks such as empanadas, yuca bread, "corviches" [green banana and fish dish], chicken and rice, as well as natural fruit juice. Everything that she makes is very healthy so that the children have healthy food.

This loan is going to be used for purchasing oil, bananas, peanuts, fruit, and other provisions for the preparation of the food. She has been part of Grupo De Crédito from the beginning and likes it because with her first loan she started her business. Her dreams are to continue to advance.

loans.use: to buy oil, bananas, peanuts, fruit, and other provisions.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, él   tiene 40 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de  la cual tiene seis hijos, él es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a la elaboración de adobe y le va muy bien, él también se dedica a la agricultura donde siembra papa y maíz. 

Julio sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Miraflores” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos.

Julio nació en la comunidad de Mashuay y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Mashuay está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julio thanks the investors of his loan and is happy for the support. He is 40 years old and has a common-law marriage and six children. He is a hard worker who supports his family. It has already been 8 years since be began making adobe and he is doing very well. He is also engaged in agriculture, planting potatoes and corn. 

Julio still belongs to the community bank "Miraflores" and needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

Julio was born in the community of Mashuay and lives in the same community where he was born. Mashuay is located in the district of Challabamba in the province Paucartambo within the department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his corn and potato crops.

loans.name: Simon Bolivar

texts.es:
Simón tiene 53 años de edad vive en unión libre, junto a su esposa no tiene hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR 28 de Enero  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El retorno, Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Simón se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y a la crianza de pollos, patos, cuyes. Compra sus productos en el Comercial del Cantón Puerto Pechiche y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes para los cultivos para polvillo, balanceado de engorde y morocho para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. 

Su sueño es poder dinero para realizar un viaje fuera del pais.

En los tiempos libres le gusta trabajar en la camioneta realizando los fletes.
texts.en:
Simon is 53 years old and lives with his common-law wife and no children in the Ventanas canton of Los Rios Province. 


The '28 de Enero' communal bank is located in El Retorno, in Puerto Pechiche parish in Pueblo Viejo canton. They work in agriculture and short-cycle farming, planting corn and rice. 


Simon works in agriculture, planting corn and rice and raising chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs. He buys his products in the shopping center of Puerto Pechiche canton, and he sells there and in Ventanas. 


He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers for crops for rice feed, fattening feed, and hard maize for the animals. The support from this loan will help him to financially cover his needs. He faces challenges like pests and illnesses. 


His dream is to be able to afford to travel outside of the country. In his free time Simon likes to work on his truck and transport cargo.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizers for the crops for rice feed, fattening feed, and hard maize for the animals.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is an entrepreneur who works with a small team of socially minded partners to improve the lives of farmers throughout Kenya.  A few years ago, Caroline started her own business to support farmers and their employees in the flower and tea-growing region of the Rift Valley and Western Kenya, where she has improved the lives of thousands by providing access to sustainable energy products that are needed within local communities.

Caroline’s product line now includes solar energy solutions, as well as improved cook stoves, which she and her small team sell on farms, in factories, savings and credit cooperatives, and in open-air markets.  The team also conducts trainings and live demos for community members to see the positive aspects of solar when compared to traditional energy sources such as candles, kerosene, and disposable batteries.  With years of experience selling a variety of solar products and building a reputation in her community, Caroline began working with One Degree’s team in Kenya in 2012 after hearing about BrightBox, a new solar energy kit that powers lights, phones, and radios.  During initial demos, customers would get excited when seeing BrightBox lights in action; Caroline acted quickly as an entrepreneur. 

Since April 2013, Caroline has already sold over 230 BrightBox kits to her customers.  She already has requests for many more, which she would like to provide before the holidays.  While happy with her initial success, Caroline has been selling to customers on a regular cash basis, while many others cannot afford to pay upfront.  These same customers are often stuck spending $10-$15 per month - a considerable portion of their income - on lighting and phone charging.

To break this cycle and provide renewable energy to these customers, Caroline would like to start offering flexible payment terms to those who need it most, while also increasing her inventory on hand to serve more customers.  She seeks support from Kiva lenders to make this happen.

Caroline will use funds for 170 units of Bright Boxes solar kits, which will energize and empower households across her region.  Customers will be able to collect BrightBox systems immediately and pay for them upfront or over several months.  Since they are currently spending money on polluting, unsafe, and inefficient energy, most will save enough to recoup costs in 4-5 months and never worry about fuel or fire again. With your help, Caroline will help families eliminate energy expenses, improve safety, and allow their children to read into the night.

loans.use: to pay for solar energy systems and offer financing plans to lower-income farmers and farm employees.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is a married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For more than two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetables stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Ada De Jesús

texts.es:
Ada de 40 años de edad, es una persona soltera, estudio hasta noveno grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Para iniciar con sus labores agrícolas, que consiste en el cultivo de maíz y al cuido de animales (vacas) oficio que aprendió de sus padres.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vacas que le venden para producir  leche y elaborar queso y ofrecerlos a sus vecinos y en los alrededores de donde reside.

Ella  en un futuro, espera  comprar mas animales y poder producir mas leche para la venta.
texts.en:
Ada is 40 years old and is a single woman who studied until the 9th grade. She gets up at 5 am to start her work farming, consisting of the cultivation of maize and the care of animals (cows), a trade she learned from her parents.

The loan she is applying for from Fundación Campo is to purchase two cows to produce milk and make cheese to sell to her neighbors around where she lives.

Later, she hopes to buy more animals and to produce more milk for sale.

loans.use: to purchase two cows to produce milk and cheese to sell.

loans.name: Selevesta

texts.en: Selevesta is a 43-year-old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a butchery as his main business, and also takes contracts building houses, which has earned him some extra income. He is facing the challenges of customers who delay in paying him and quarantines on all animals because of diseases, which has been leading to low sales. However, he has a vision of buying land. Selevesta has asked for a loan to buy cows for slaughtering this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering this Christmas season.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 58-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For many days, the rickshaw has not been working properly so her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Shazia's husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Repairing the rickshaw will help Shazia's husband continue his business. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона трудолюбивая и умная девушка. Ей 21 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она успешно окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Национальный Университет Таджикистана. Она учится на 3 курсе в очное отделение по специальности журналистики. Фарзона является успешной студенткой. Она учится хорошо и отлично. Фарзона должна оплатить за учебный договор, но ее родители не имеют денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Farzona is a hardworking and smart girl. She is 21 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She successfully finished high school and started at the Tajik National University. She studies in the third year as a full-time student, specializing in journalism. 

Farzona is a successful student. She studies hard and well. She needs to pay for her tuition, but her parents do not have the money. She requests a loan to pay for her tuition, and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her education

loans.name: Ena Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Ena es una persona emprendedora, honesta y seria, vive con su esposo y  sus hijos en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la compra y venta de cerdos.
Doña Ena el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de cerdos. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas de su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos  y con esto mejorar su situación económica. 
Doña Ena espera que a un corto plazo siga creciendo y consolidándose para que su negocio se  convierta en el más grande y reconocido de la región y seguir apoyando a su familia, para que sus hijos se convierta en unas personas honestas con principios  valores y con mejores  oportunidades . 


Choluteca, Honduras  – Diciembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Sra. Ena is an enterprising, honest, and serious person. She and her husband and children live in the south of Honduras. She earns her living buying and selling pigs.

Ena now needs a loan to buy more pigs which she hopes will lead to more sales as she will have more to sell to her customers. The money she earns will be used to buy household necessities and improve the family’s financial situation.

In the short term Ena hopes that her business will continue growing into something larger and more well-known in the region. She wants to continue helping her family so that her children will grow up to be honest principled people with good opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras -- December 2013

loans.use: buy pigs for her business

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 6 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of this group, called Amor Y Amistad 6 ("Love and Friendship"). The area in which the borrowers live is a nascent tourist zone, surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean and mountains, rivers, and natural breezes. 

Yolanda is a single woman who lives in the beautiful town of Samana. She says her most important challenge is to keep her business stable and sustainable. She enjoys working and serving the needs of her family and friends.

Yolanda is receiving her 17th loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic, having repaid all her previous loans. After eight years of investment, her business has been growing to the point where she is selling a greater range of products and acquiring more clients and communities. 

Yolanda will use this loan to purchase cosmetic products. She will reinvest her profits in her business and she is also planning to add other high-demand products, such as school supplies. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Ей 35 лет ее зовут Гулчехра. Она замужем. В браке у нее есть три ребенка. У Гулчехры большая семья. Кроме мужа и троих детей с ней живут ее мама и брат с женой. Гулчехра всегда хотела иметь большую и дружную семью, ее мечта сбылась, но обеспечить свою семью и своих детей становиться сложнее.
    Она около трех лет занимается продажей фруктов и овощей, в том числе разных сортов яблок, груш, гранат, винограда, помидоров, огурцов и много разных овощей. В работе ей помогает ее муж, но в основном за прилавком она торгует сама. Чтобы дать своим детям нужное образование и чтобы они не в чем не нуждались, ей приходиться выйти на работу в любую погоду. 
  На данный момент у Гулчехры не хватает денег, чтобы привести новый товар для продажи. Она просит кредит для купли фруктов и овощей. Она решила купить товар, привезенный из республики Узбекистана и Киргизии. И тем самым привлечь глаза покупателей новыми сортами фруктов.
texts.en:
This woman is 35 years old, and is called Gulchehra. She is married, and they have three children. Gulchehra has a large family. In addition to her husband and three children, her mother, brother and sister-in-law also live with her. Gulchehra always wanted to have a large and friendly family, so her dream came true. However to provide for her family and children has become more complicated. 

For around three years, Gulchehra has worked with selling fruit and vegetables, such as different types of apples, pears, pomegranates, grapes, tomatoes, cucumbers and many different vegetables. Her husband helps her with the work, but she mostly stands behind the counter alone. In order to give her children the right education, and so that they are not in need of anything, she has to go to work in any weather. 

Currently, Gulchehra does not have enough money to purchase new goods to sell. She requests a loan to purchase fruit and vegetables. She decided to purchase goods brought from the Republic of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan, and thus attract more customers with the new varieties of fruit.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Ngone's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 36 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 22 octobre 2013. Il est composé des membres qui vivent dans la même localité et les environs. Les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaire. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Maty, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 03 garçons. Sa principale activité est le commerce. Elle achète 30 Kg d'arachide pour un montant global de 105 000 F qu'elle va transformer en huile. Avec ces 30 Kg, elle peut avoir 06 bidons de 20 L d'huile qu'elle va revendre à 16 000 F le bidon. Elle vend aussi le tourteaux qui en découle à 150 F la boulette dont 100 boulettes ce qui fait un total de 15 000 F. Mais tout dépend de la qualité de l'arachide sur le marché.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre de renforcer son épargne, mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants quand le besoin se fait sentir.
texts.en:
This group has 36 members and is part of a banc villageois that was created on October 22, 2013. It is made up of members who live in the same locality and surrounding area. They all get along well together and support each other. Their principal activity is commerce.

Maty, standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of six children, of whom three are boys. Her main activity is commerce. She buys 30 kilos of peanuts for 105,000 XOF, which she will use to make oil. With these 30 kilos, she can make six twenty-liter drums of oil that she will sell for 16,000 XOF each. She will also sell the oil cake that remains after extracting the oil for 150 XOF for each pellet. She expects the oil cake to make 100 pellets, which makes a total of 15,000 XOF. But it all depends on the quality of the peanuts available at the market.

The profits will allow her to increase her savings, but also to provide for the needs of her children as they arise.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Maryuri De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maryuri es una joven de 25 años de edad, su esposo labora como albañil por cuenta propia  con quien procreo un hijo que tiene un año, Maryuri es micro empresaria se dedica a realizar helados y hielo para venderlos en su casa de habitación, también comercializa ropa nueva por encargo. Sus deseos es aumentar las ventas, por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar bolsas para empacar los hielos y frutas para hacer variedades de helados también invertir en un poco de ropa, con los ingresos que genere apoyar a su esposo e hijo a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maryuri is a young woman of 25. Her husband is a self-employed  construction worker. They have a one-year old son.

Maryuri has a small business selling ice cream and ice in her house. She also sells new clothing on assignment. As she wishes to increase sales, she is seeking a loan to buy bags for packaging ice and fruit and make different types of ice cream. She also wishes to buy more clothing. With the income she earns she wants to help her husband and son to get on in life.

loans.use: buy bags, fruit and clothing

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is 23 years old, married, and lives in Gaza, with her husband and three children. She started her beauty salon business in 2011 and she has had a good experience in this field. 

Rasha asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a hair dryer, makeup tools, and electronics for her salon. This will help her to improve her job, which will enable her to improve her financial situation.

She dreams of expanding her business and she desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education in the future. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business, through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, makeup tools, and electronics for her salon.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman, with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past two years, Jane has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Jane wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kongnga's Group

texts.en: Kongnga is 27 years old and a father of two dependent kids residing in Battambang province. He strives to make a living via rice farming and his paid job. This is the business that he has had for several years and it has returned him about 23,000 KHR per day. With this new loan, he is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After a successful repayment of his original loan with VisionFund, Kongnga is able to make his lifestyle better than before. Now, he is teaming up with a  group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to pay for harvesting fees. He highly believes that he can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: To pay harvesting fees.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a hardworking and enterprising man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He is married with nine children all of whom are adults.  

Simon sells goat meat to various butcheries and hotels. He has been in this business for the past five years. He cites seasonality as his major challenge.

With the 50,000 KES he wants to purchase more goats for his business. He joined Yehu to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for his business

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is still a single man who is very hardworking and responsible. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the past year, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites the high cost of maintenance as his major challenge. Besides the motorcycle business, he practices dairy farming and sells goat meat to various shops. 

With the 80,000 KES he wants to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle

loans.name: Salimu

texts.en:
Salimu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. In addition to selling fruits and vegetables, Salimu operates a cloth-selling business. She is now requesting a loan of Ksh 20,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. 

Salimu thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school and one is underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more goats to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
This is Prisca. Her previous loan was a big help in her business; she was able to purchase more clothes for her business.

She would like to apply for a loan of ksh.20,000 to purchase bales of clothes for her business. 

Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Everline's Group

texts.en:
Everline’s group has three group leader farmers and is located in Busia District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 28 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for one-quarter acre of maize and one-quarter acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Everline is pictured on the right of the Madete Kaviri Group with her hand raised.
							
Everline is a reliable member of the community. She is married with seven children. Everline is 35 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 25 years to support her family. In addition to this, she is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group, prayer group, and burial committee. She described her harvest last year as not being with One Acre Fund. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and enjoy the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

Everline joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. She joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school. Because she likes being a leader, and she is an active community member, Everline wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Everline has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Everline's life because she has more farm training and more farm group support and was able to feed the family. In the future, Everline hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school, repair the home, save for the future, and buy a goat.  

Everline and the Madete Kaviri Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married with two children who both attend school. She also takes care of her sister and brother. She resides in her own house and although the family has access to electricity, they do not have piped water.

She sells second-hand shoes at the market to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of second-hand shoes. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children through university. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margret is single with three children and all her children go to school. She sells pineapples on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for three years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy pineapples and watermelons. Her major business challenges include seasonality and theft. She hopes to grow pineapples and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for utilities and for food to feed the family.

loans.use: To buy more pineapples and watermelons for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards, and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.20,000 to purchase bales of clothes to sell. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha de 48 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad de 12, 7 años. Es originaria de la zona central de la región.se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Desde muy joven lucha en la vida para poder sobrevivir y ayudar a su familia. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económico. En la actualidad luchan día a  día para ayudar a sus hijos que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de café y pan de forma ambulante, la venta de tortillas la realiza en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. EL objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de materia prima como café, vasos, azúcar, bolsas, pan, servilletas, maíz lena. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Martha agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old, and is married with two young children aged 7 and 12. She is from the central part of the region, and is known for being hardworking and responsible, with the desire to better herself. From a very young age, she has fought to survive and help her family. Unfortunately, she was never able to study because she didn't have enough money. Today, her and her husband work every day to help their children and improve their living conditions. 

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, she works as a mobile seller of coffee and bread, and sells tortillas in her home. She works on her business for 12 hours a day offering her products.

The aim of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling raw materials such as coffee, glasses, sugar, bags, bread, serviettes, corn and firewood. In this way, in the not so distant future she can obtain higher earnings. Martha is grateful for the help given by Kiva lenders to people with limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital in buying and selling raw materials to sell coffee, bread, tortillas, glasses, sugar, bags, serviettes, corn and firewood.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a hard-working and enterprising woman who lives in a coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Anne has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Anne wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase four goats for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase four goats for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy chicken, meat, basic grains, dairy products, soft drinks, and corn.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 29-year-old married man, who has three children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is motorcycle transportation, alongside selling fresh foods. He started these businesses with a vision of supporting himself and boosting his income. He is facing challenges of changeable weather, and a scarcity of fresh foods in the dry season. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new market areas. Patrick is in need of a loan to repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles used the previous loan to buy firewood and iron sheets and to pay for labor to construct a sun shade. He has continued with the same business, making bricks, alongside running a saloon and brick laying, in order to boost his income. He is facing challenges, including weather changes and the new rules concerning deforestation, which make it hard for him to get firewood. In spite of these, he has a vision of beginning a hardware business. Charles has asked for a loan to buy firewood, for baking bricks.

loans.use: to buy firewood, for baking bricks.

loans.name: Wajdi

texts.en:
Wajdi is 30 years old and lives in Jinen. In 2009 he thought to do something to contribute to the family income, as his parent’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of all family members. At the beginning, he was selling clothes at a stall on the street. Now he rents a shop, and he has begun selling men's clothes and shoes. He worked hard to improve his business, dreaming of providing good living conditions for his family.

Wajdi is asking Ryada for this youth loan. He will use it to buy clothes and shoes to increase his stock. This will lead to an increase in his income. Wajdi is very grateful to everyone who will help him to achieve success in this business.

loans.use: to increase his stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Irene Esperanza

texts.es:
Irene es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia: 

Irene tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica al comercio desde hace 10 años,  inició ayudándole a su abuela que vendía dulces, juguetes y papelería afuera de una primaria y desde hace 3 años inició su propio negocio de comida. 

Irene tiene una cocina económica, la cual había iniciado con su primo pero él no soporto el ritmo de trabajo, por lo que se quedó atendiéndola sola. También cuenta con unos baños dentro del mercado al cual cobra la entrada. Solicita este crédito para hacer unas mejoras en su hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia. 

Gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo ella ha logrado gozar de estabilidad económica con su familia, sin tener que preocuparse por ofrecerles comida y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irene is a small-scale businesswoman and a customer of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

Irene is 26 and lives with her common-law husband. She has two children. She has worked in commerce for 10 years, starting by helping her grandmother, who sold sweets, toys and stationery outside a primary school, and then 3 years ago she started up her own food business. Irene has a low-cost kitchen, which she started with her cousin, but he could not handle the pace of the work, which meant she ended up looking after it on her own. She also has some pay toilets inside the market, and she charges for their use.

Irene is asking for this loan to make some improvements to her home and to have a better qualify of life for her family. Thanks to the effort she puts into her work, she has succeeded in enjoying economic stability with her family, without having to worry about giving her children food and providing them with an education.

loans.use: to make the necessary improvements to her home.

loans.name: Pisey's Group

texts.en: A mother of six children and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Pisey is 35 years old and a farmer who raises pigs as her main source of income. To earn additional profits, her family can earn additional income via working for others for a fee. This business has returned her almost 37,000 KHR per day. This is Pisey's sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has had a successful repayment of her past loans which has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy five more piglets and pay pig fees to support her business. She highly believes that she can gain more income from her business so as she can build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy five more piglets and pay pig fees to support her business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Doeurn's Group

texts.en:
Doeurn, age 40, is a rice farmer. Her entire family mainly relies on rice cropping as a single business to support their living. She has been engaged in her business for many years and it has enabled her to earn up to 35,000 KHR per day. Doeurn and her husband have been blessed with five children.

Doeurn has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for seven cycles and has maintained a successful repayment history. The positive impact of her loans has enabled her to support and improve her family's standard of living. 

She is now joining a group of two borrowers to request a new loan. As the leader of the group, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the reaping fees for her rice crop. 

She is confident that she can gain a better yield than ever before.

loans.use: to pay the reaping fees for her rice crop

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, shampoo, acondicionadores para el cabello, perfumes, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa de un familiar con su madre y su hija de 7 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para su negocio  ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles, con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client makes a living selling all types of products for personal use such as lotions, deodorants, creams, shampoo and conditioner for hair, perfumes, etc. Her business is located inside her residence. With the profits from her sales she is able to pay for household expenses. She lives in a relative's house with her mother and her 7-year-old daughter who currently studies. 

The client wishes to grow her business and for this reason requests a loan which will permit her to buy everything that is necessary for her business. She has many customers because she sells her products at affordable prices. With the requested support she will have greater earnings and will be able to continue providing a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, creams, shampoo and conditioner for hair, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Estrellas Brillantes 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of Las Estrellas Brillantes (Shining Stars) Group 1 and 2, which consists of 10 micro-entrepreneurs from Samana. Samana is a tourist city located in the northeastern part of the country. 

Rosa is the mother of two children. She lives with them and her long-term partner. She sells groceries at her food market, which is called a "colmado" in the Dominican Republic. There she sells daily meals to her neighbors.

She started her business almost eight years ago with her own savings. Now she is requesting her seventh loan. She will use this loan to buy flour, cooking oil, butter, rice, beans, sugar, and other goods. Previous loans have improved her business. 

Rosa wants to save her profits to reinvest into her business, and build a house with a better structure than the one she currently has. Rosa and her group thank you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, butter, rice, beans, sugar, and other goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentions seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 15,000 KES she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mohamed Yusuf

texts.en: Mohamed Yusuf is a 23 years old. He studies nutrition at the University of Hargeisa. He needs a laptop to prepare his assignments, read his lessons when given as soft copy, and download extra lessons. He has requested that Kaaba give him a laptop as a loan, and now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide him the laptop as a loan, and Mohamed will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Bisina

texts.en:
Bisina is a 24-year-old housewife. She is the mother of three daughters. Her husband, Safiqul, is 30 years old and a farmer by profession. Bisina passed standard V (grade 5) but her husband is not literate and only can sign his name. Two of her school-going daughters are students of class I (grade 1) and class II (grade 2). The other one is too small for going to school. They live in their own kaccha house (made of straw and mud) at the small village of Baromaria in the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.

Bisina’s husband, Safiqul, has been farming for many years to supplement their family’s income. But her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family’s need. 

Bisina wanted to support her husband financially and decided to start growing potatoes on their own plot of land, and sell them in the market to generate a large profit. She has given preference to growing potatoes because potato cultivation is a profitable business in her remote area. She hopes this business will enable her to improve her standard of living.

Bisina is going to use her loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good-quality potato seeds and fertilizers to farm potatoes on their land. 

In the future, she wants to purchase a cycle van with the profit from her business to carry the vegetables to the market. She might rent it for further income also.

Bisina is grateful to BJS and Kiva for getting the loan.

loans.use: to buy good-quality potato seeds and fertilizers to farm potatoes.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene 58 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 9 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias Lempira junto con su esposa y cuatro de sus hijos. El siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura y a la comercialización de granos básicos. Lleva aproximadamente 25 años de cultivar café y esta producción la vende en el mercado de la zona. Esta solicitando un préstamo que es por 10,000 y lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para la siembra de café. Con esta inversión espera tener mejor cultivo y lograr mayor producción de café. Su plan es mantener esta actividad para poder ayudar a sus hijos menores con sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 58 years old and married. He has nine children and lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias Lempira together with his wife and four of his children. He has always worked in agriculture focusing on the commercialization of basic grains. He has about 25 years of experience cultivating coffee and sells his crops in local markets. 

He is requesting a loan for 10,000 and he will invest it in the purchase of fertilizers and to hire labor to sow coffee plants. With this investment he hopes to have a better harvest and greater coffee production. His plan is to continue this line of work to be able to help his younger children with their projects.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and hire labor to sow coffee plants

loans.name: Ángela Ubilvida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer y trabaja fuera de la ciudad.
Doña Ángela tiene un puesto en el mercado  de la ciudad de  en el cual vende frutas y verduras. Trabaja todos los fines de semana ya que son los días de feria, en estos días trabaja desde las  05h00 hasta las 14h00, ella se desplaza desde la madrugada junto a uno de sus hijos  hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para luego  poder ofrecerles el mejor producto a sus clientes, este negocio lo tenía su marido pero por motivos de trabajo se fue a otra ciudad y ella y su hijo están a cargo del negocio el cual ya lleva más de 10 años y con el cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y verduras. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de víveres
texts.en:
The “Esperanza Nueva” borrowing group meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This area is known for being very dynamic, where most of the residents are farmers and raise livestock.  It’s an area of great vegetation.

Angela lives here.  She is 46 years old, married, and has four minor children, two of the living at home.  Her husband is a driver and works outside the city.

Angela has a market stall in town, where she sells fruits and vegetables.  She works every weekend because those are fair days and she works from 5:00 am to 2:00 pm.  She and her children go out at dawn to the main market to buy the best products so she can offer them to her customers.  Her husband had this business before, but he went to work in another city and she and her son are now in charge of it.  She has done this for more than 10 years and they are getting ahead.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fruits and vegetables.  She has been with the group since the beginning and likes the help that the institution provides.  Her dreams are to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Action Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleases to present to you members of the “Action” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their individual businesses. 

Isata is the featured leader of this group. Isata is a widow with five children. Three of her children are attending schools and two are no longer attending school. Isata sells cooked food. She is going to use her share of the loan to buy cooking ingredients in large volume in order to cook more food for sale.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Furaha Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Saumu, who is in her late 40s, is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters.  Three of them are still going to school and the eldest has finished school.  She has been a food vendor for seven years now.  She works from 6am to 4pm daily and is able to make a good monthly income.  

This will be Saumu's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy cooking supplies.  She also renovated her restaurant by putting in new iron sheets and tiles in order to make the place attractive to customers.  She is really happy and appreciates the loans. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a farm and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy food and cold drinks to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of giving her children a good education and to be successful in life.

Saumu will share this loan with her loan group Furaha Tegeta, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy food and drinks for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes such as t-shirts, trousers, blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.es:
Marilyn agradece a los inversionitas por el prestamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de  la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. Su actividad económica principal es la enseñanza pues ella es profesora de nivel inicial, ella también tiene un pequeño negocio de brindar servicio de hospedaje. 

Marilyn perteneciendo al banco comunal “Miraflores” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de su casa o sea va ser refaccionar los baños.   

Marilyn nació en el departamento de Apurímac pero vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo. (El distrito de Paucartambo en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Marilyn is grateful to the lenders for her loan and happy for the support offered. She is 34 years old and is in a common-law relationship, from which she has two children. She is a hardworking person who helps her family to get ahead. Her main economic activity is teaching, as she is a primary school teacher. She also has a small business providing lodging. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Miraflores," and at this time she needs a loan for home maintenance, as she will renovate the bathrooms. Marilyn was born in the department of Apurimac but lives in the city of Paucartambo. (This is in the district of Paucartambo, in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to renovate her home's bathrooms

loans.name: Lidia Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con sus 2 hijos en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es venta de comida y el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de condimentos, carnes, arroz, queso, manteca, cebollas, etc.
Doña Lidia con el préstamo espera que las ventas del negocio aumenten al tener más producto para ofrecer y atender mejor a sus clientes y a su vez espera cubrir las necesidades que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña Lidia en unos años espera que su negocio siga creciendo y se convierta en uno de los negocios más grandes y reconocidos de la zona y que sus hijos se convierta en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras  – Diciembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Lidia is a responsible, hard-working and honest person. She lives with her two children in the south of Honduras. Lidia has a business selling meals and needs this loan in order to buy condiments, meat, rice, cheese, butter, onions and more.

Lidia hopes that, with this loan, her sales will increase as she will have more products to offer and can better tend her customers. She also hopes to be able to cover her expenses and to improve her and her family's quality of life a little.

Within a few years Lidia hopes that her business will expand and become one of the biggest and best-well known in the area. She wants her children to be good people and for them to have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras, December 2013

loans.use: to buy condiments, meat, rice, cheese, butter, onions and more for her business.

loans.name: Katysoka

texts.en:
Katysoka is married with seven children: three adults and the rest in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a mat-weaving business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of reefs and a tins of dye to paint her mats. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of reefs and a tins of dye to paint her mats.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married to Gertrude and they have five children. He is involved in transportation and they have been struggling to acquire a new truck but the funds have not favoured them. They got a chance to know Ugafode from a friend, so they approached the institution to help them acquire a truck that will be used to transport people's goods at a fee. He hopes that this will help them to raise enough funds to pay for their children's tuition.

loans.use: to pay for a truck.

loans.name: Assaf

texts.en:
Assaf is 19 years old.  He lives with his family in Gaza.  He has a store selling a school products and earns a monthly income $600.  He started his business at the first of November 2011.

Assaf needs this youth loan to buy a printer machine and new school products.  Assaf  is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.  His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education, and he hopes that someday to restart his education over again.

loans.use: buy a printer and school products

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is 28 years old.  He lives with his parents in Fara camp at Nablus, one of the camps established after the Palestinian Nakba, in an area of 225,000 square meters.

Ibraheem is asking Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house and structure doors and windows.  He wants to help his family with this loan to improve the house and make it better, which will able them to live in with more psychological comfort.  He is very grateful to everyone who helps him

loans.use: to buy flagstones to improve his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Tajat

texts.en:
Tajat is an experienced farmer from village of Jigrasheni in Ninotsminda district. He has a wife and a student daughter. His wife is a housekeeper and is a hard-worker who supports her beloved husband in making their precious family's living and covering their increasing needs, especially their daughter's education. 

Tajat's family is involved in agricultural activities, in particular they have 5 cattle and cultivate potatoes on their agricultural land. Tajat sells the harvested potatoes to the local market and monthly generates approximately 700 GEL. He has great desire to improve his agricultural activity, buy milk cows and sell their products locally, and also to supply food for the animals. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $3000. Tajat and his family is thankful to all lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: buy dairy cows and livestock feed

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is from the village of Nasakirali in the western part of Georgia. He is 29 years, married and has two sons (2 and 7 years old). The young family runs a  small-scale agricultural business to earn a living. Specifically, they grow citrus, maize and potatoes on their own plot of land and sell the harvest periodically.

In order to increase his family monthly income, Zviad plans to start a new business. With the received loan amount, he will start a shoe sales business in his district. Zviad will hire the commercial space and buy stocks of winter shoes at wholesale prices. He will sell the items for a profit himself and generate income.  He is inexperienced in the trading business and  hopes he will have a successful project due to his hard work.  Zviad hopes this Kiva loan will be helpful for his family.

loans.use: to start a shoe sales business

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is a 49-year-old married woman from the small village in Lagodekhi district. She lives with her husband, 26-year-old son, and pensioner mother-in-law. Mzia works at the dining hall of the local school.  She prepares dishes and rolls for children. Her son works as a security guard and gets 225 Gels per month.  Her husband is unemployed. 

Mzia requested a loan though the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  This program enables her to get a loan of $3400 to purchase a car.  After the car is purchased, her husband will serve the local people as a taxi driver to generate income. With the increased income, Mzia will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy a car for her husband to start a taxi business

loans.name: Thy Will Be Group

texts.en:
Please meet members of the Thy Will Be Group from Dansoman, a fast-growing business area in Accra, Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to ID Ghana, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of GHS 3,900 to supplement their capital. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Nelly is the featured leader of this group. The 41-year-old woman is married to a trader and they have three children. Nelly has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. She sells clothing and slippers. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of clothing and slippers to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothing and slippers to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang is a mother of three kids and is in her late 40s.  She resides in Kampong Cham province and is a local farmer who strives for a living via rice farming. To earn more income, her husband works for others for a fee at construction sites. This is the first loan for Neang with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner).  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a cow for raising and to support her rice farming. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from this cow-raising business so that she can gain a good income to buy pigs to supplement her income.

loans.use: buy a cow

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Buana

texts.en: Balinese artisan Buana specializes in handmade jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of silver and natural gemstones for production. Buana has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story: "I've been surrounded by handicrafts all my life. I am thankful to God for giving me such a great gift so I can make a living for my family. Not much, perhaps, but enough for our simple way of life." "With your support through this microcredit loan, I'll be able to prepare a good stock for this holiday season. I would like to send my thanks to all of you for this opportunity because it will make make my sales grow. I also hope you like my handcrafted jewelry - I will be very happy if one of my creations becomes a part of your daily joy." Use the link below to view Buana's handmade jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5503

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of silver and natural gemstones for production.

loans.name: Maragret

texts.en: Margaret is married with six children, two of whom go to school. She has one additional family member, a grandchild. She sells charcoal on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for 12 years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start selling food stuff. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anjuma

texts.en:
Anjuma is a 26-year-old woman, married to Minu, age 32. They live in Magurmari village in a small town, Dhupguri. They have four daughters. Two of them are in class III (grade 3) and class I (grade 1) in school, and the other two are below school-going age.
