Хайбулло планирует в будущем открыть еще один бизнес, то есть купле продажей топлива. Хайбулло нуждается в автомашине для развития своего бизнеса. Хайбулло запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки автомашины. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Haybullo was born in 1962. He is married with four children. For more than two years he has bought and sold household appliances. Haybullo is gradually building his business. With hard work and a gregarious personality he is attracting more clients. He still needs more money to support his family because his children grow year by year and have more needs. 

Haybullo is planning to open another business buying and selling fuel. He needs a car to grow his business, and is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS for this purpose. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a new car for his business.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de granos secos, carne y frutas, y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar más carne y papa, ella nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 48 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, ella es una madre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority”.
texts.en: Teofila is grateful to the investors for her loan.  She feels happy about the help they have provided her.  She continues to make her living selling dry grains, meat and fruit.  At this time, she needs a loan to purchase more meat and potatoes.  Teofila was born in the city of Paucartambo and still lives there.  She is 48-years old, is married and with her husband has five children.   Teofila is a hard-working and enterprising mother who gets her family ahead through her hard work.  Teofila is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the communal bank “Señor de Coyllority.”

loans.use: to buy meat and potatoes.

loans.name: Nibaldo Orlando

texts.es:
Nibaldo tiene 33 años de edad estado civil unión libre, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Nibaldo se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas.  Solicita el préstamo para  poder comprar los fertilizantes para la siembra y para arrendar  terrenos.  Las compras lo realiza en el cantón ventanas.   Su sueño es mejorar su cultivo y la producción para tener una mejor calidad de  vida. El desafío  que enfrenta es combatir contra la naturaleza.  En su tiempo libre la gusta criar animales y un rato ver la television
texts.en:
Nibaldo is 33 years old and in a common law relationship. He lives with his wife and their three children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. Nibaldo is a member of the Communal Bank "Bruniquilde", which is located in the neighborhood of Calabi in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farm work.

Nibaldo grows corn and raises chickens. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy fertilizers to use for planting and to rent farmland. His purchases are conducted in the canton of Ventanas.

Nibaldo's dream is to improve his crop and his production so that he can have a better quality of life. The challenge he faces is having to battle against the forces of nature. In his free moments, he enjoys raising animals and watching television for periods of time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to rent farmland.

loans.name: 6 De Noviembre Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento 6 DE NOVIEMBRE está compuesto por nueve integrantes todas mujeres que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es  la señora Andrea tiene 59 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de verduras como cebollas en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona Arica de la ciudad de La paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Andrea va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería como cebolla por carga,  la señora Andrea enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona son varias las personas que venden ver5duras, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder también vender todo tipo de verduras, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “6 de Noviembre” (November 6th) consists of nine members. All of them are women who engage in various activities.

The bank president is Sra. Andrea, age 59. She sells vegetables, such as onions, from a vending stall located in the Arica District in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan cycle with Emprender. Sra. Andrea will use her loan to buy merchandise, such as onions by the load. She encounters challenges in her business, such as the competition since there are several vegetable vendors in her district.

Sra. Andrea will use her profits to continue buying merchandise and to increase her capital for selling all types of vegetables. She is pleased and appreciates this credit opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy onions in bulk.

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en:
Mkambe is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school and one underage. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to Mansur, who is 42 years old. Mansur is a farmer. They both are illiterate and can only sign their names. They have four children going to school. 

Haseena is a dedicated mother, as well as a hardworking housewife. Haseena lives in her own kaccha house, which is made of mud and straw. She works hard from dawn to dusk for her family’s economic and social condition.

Mansur grows chilies on their own plot of land and sells them to the local market. But the earnings from their business are too low. They spend their daily life very poorly. Due to lack of capital, they could not grow their business and earn much profit from the business. 

Haseena came to know about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and applied for a loan to buy more good quality chili seeds and good fertilizers for growing chilies in a large scale in her own field, and sell those chilies to the market. Nowadays, there is huge demand for chilies in the market.

She understood that more production of chilies will help them to gain profit from her business. Her contribution should make her business smooth; she will be able to give a good future to her children, also including their education. She desires to build a new concrete house for her family where they can stay in a better living condition. So, she wants a loan of 15,000 INR to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase chili seeds and fertilizers for growing chilies.

loans.name: Gloria Alicia

texts.es:
Gloria de 63 años de edad, es una persona viuda, estudio hasta noveno grado, su esposo ya falleció y ella tiene que velar por su sustento diario ya que sus hijos no le pueden ayudar. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m, para iniciar con sus actividades agrícolas.

 Gloria  se dedica al cultivo de maíz, camina 2 Km para llegar a la parcelas donde siembra y ademas se dedica al cuido de animales (vacas) oficio que aprendió de sus padres.   

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas que le venden para producir  leche  y ofrecerle a sus vecinos y en los alrededores de donde reside para obtener un ingreso adicional.

Gloria espera, en un futuro poder comprar mas animales y poder producir mas leche para la venta.
texts.en:
Gloria is 63 years old and a widow.  She completed up to ninth grade at school.  Gloria's husband died and so she has to work for her daily bread as her children cannot help her.  Gloria gets up at 5am in order to start her farming work.

Gloria makes a living growing corn.  She walks two kilometres to the plots of land where she sows her seeds.  In addition, Gloria work raising animals (cows), a trade she learned from her parents.

Gloria will use this loan to buy two cows to produce milk to sell to her neighbours and in the surrounding areas.  This will give her an extra income.

Gloria hopes that, in the future, she can buy more animals and produce more milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to produce milk.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mary from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown in Sierra Leone.  She is married with two children.  For the past 10 years, Mary has established her local food business. She began her business because she wants to sustain herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and having a proper business location.

Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more rice, fish and cooking seasonings.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mary plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Mbalu from the Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with six children.  In 2007, Mbalu established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to contribute with taking care of her children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and having a proper business location.

Mbalu requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mbalu plans to open a large provisions store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Salwa Group

texts.en: This group is called Salwa; it is made up of four ladies. This group demonstrates initiative, values, and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. Lubnan is a 33-year-old married woman. She is the leader of this group and she lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  She has sold new clothes for adults and children, perfumes, incense, etc. for a few years. She buys her merchandise from distributors and stores where the prices are cheaper. She started this business because of the lack of these products in her neighborhood.  She is very grateful to her neighbors who have supported her over all these years. With the income from her business, she was able to upgrade her home and enjoy more comforts. She has applied for a loan  from AMB to acquire more clothing, perfumes, incense, etc. She will sell them to her customers, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her income from her business.

loans.use: to acquire more clothing, perfumes, incense, etc. to use for her business.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is married with three school-age children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Binti has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial supports.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is married and has one child who is still underage. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women, and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Saiberia Group

texts.en:
Catherine, who is in her mid 40s, is married with two children who have finished school.  She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Catherine's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy good stock of food to meet her customer's demand.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to cover household expenses, built an up to date toilet, built her house, bought a TV set, sofa set and a radio.  She is so happy with the loan.  She gives thanks for all who have supported her group, Saiberia, where everybody has benefited. She will use this loan to buy a good stock of food for her food store.  She dreams of improving her way of living.

Catherine will share this loan with her loan group "SAIBERIA", which has a total of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a good stock of food for her food store.

loans.name: Jum'a

texts.ru: Чумъа женатый мужчина, который очень любит свою семью. Он отец троих детей. Старшим сыновьям Тоирчону и Зоирчону 10 лет. Младшему сыну 8 лет. Чумъа занимает животноводством и дополнительно земледелием. Семью кормит только Чумъа и его жена очень хочет помочь мужу и обеспечить детей образованием, здоровьем. Его жена умеет шить и она, пользуясь своим мастерством, хочет предоставлять услугу портнихи. Чумъа поддерживает выбор своей жены и просит кредит, для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en:
Jum'a is a married man who loves his family very much. He is a father of three children. The older sons, Toirchon and Zoirchon, are 10 years old. The youngest son is eight. 

Jum'a breeds livestock and farms. Jum'a is the sole breadwinner, and his wife very much wants to help him and provide their children with an education and good health. 

His wife knows how to sew and she, using her skills, wants to offer dressmaking services. Jum'a supports his wife's choice and asks for a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for his wife.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад 53 летний мужчина из района Дж.Руми. Он женат на 50 летней Айсифат. Они воспитывают двоих сыновей. Им по 29 и 20 лет. Сыновья Ахмада и Айсифат находятся в Российской Федерации на заработках. Ахмад занимается земледелием, выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Он хочет начать другую деятельность, животноводство. Причина, по которой он выбрал этот бизнес, является чистый, благоприятный климат и природа Таджикистана. Ахмад надеется, что Вы ему поможете ему, и он начнет свой новый бизнес. Он собирается заняться выращивание мелко рогатых скотин. Ахмад планирует купить скотин из местного рынка Гулистон и после откорма продать с наценкой. Он надеется, что с вашей поддержкой он осуществит свои планы. Ахмад заранее благодарит Вас.
texts.en:
Ahmad is a 53-year-old man from the J. Rumy district of Tajikistan.  He is married to 50-year-old Aisifat with whom he has two sons who are now 20 and 29 years old and who are both currently working in Russia.  

Ahmad works in agriculture and grows crops.  He would now like to get involved in animal husbandry and has chosen this activity because of the pure and favorable climate of Tajikistan and its abundance of nature.  He relies on your help to start his new business.  

Ahmad is planning to raise small livestock, which he will buy at a local market in Guliston.  He will fatten his livestock and resell it for a profit.  He hopes that your support will allow him to carry out his project and he thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to start raising livestock and get involved in a new type of business.

loans.name: Salim's Group

texts.en:
Salim is a member of Bidii Farmers Ass Group in Matete District.  He is pictured here in a group of 9 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 89 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Salim has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Salim is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 3 children.  Salim is 53 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 5 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Salim is very active in his community and is involved in the prayer group.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer he is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!							

The 2013 Long Rains season will be Salim’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  As an active member in his community, Salim also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative and he wants to help more farmers.  Salim plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future and buy a goat.  He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund because he has more farm training and has more farm group support.
							
Salim and the Bidii Farmers Ass Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

Please note that there is 1 additional group leader in this photo who will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Shadrack's Group

texts.en:
Shadrack is a member of Ewe Njete Group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 9 One Acre Fund group  farmers.  The group represent a total of 95 individuals One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Shadrack has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.	
						
Shadrack is married and has 9 children.  He is 61 years old and is known as hardworking,  reliable, and trustworthy.  He is active in his community in groups such as the prayer group.  Shadrack has been a farmer for 20 years.  Shadrack described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 
 							
Shadrack first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Shadrack joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods, and earn enough to feed family.  Shadrack plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Shadrack’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest,  and was able to feed the family. 

Shadrack and the Ewe Njete Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

Please note that there are 3 additional group leaders in this photo that will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan. 
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Matelda

texts.en:
Matelda owns a small shop on the beach of Kupang.  She opened her shop when she realized that the income from her fisherman husband could not support her family of two children.  She works from dawn until midnight selling food, beverages and snacks. 

To improve her income, Matelda has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies.  She will use the loan to buy clean energy technologies such as solar lamps, water filters, and cooking stoves and grow her business.  Matelda also hopes Kopernik’s training program will improve her business skills.

Matelda is keen to educate her relatives and friends on the importance of drinking clean water and switching their cooking methods from traditional stone stoves to improve the environment and their health.

Matelda will use the extra income to sustain her family’s daily needs and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy clean energy products to sell in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling bamboo.  Lourdes is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu, 44 years, lives in a rural area, Managuri, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and has two sons. She is a housewife and passed class V (grade 5). Her husband, Nirmal, is 52 years old, and studied up to class VII (grade 7). He is engaged in supplying wood to the building contractors for construction of the cantering of houses. Both their sons are receiving education. The elder one is in college, and the younger son is in class XI (grade 11). They live in their own small pacca house (concrete made).

The main source of income for the family is her husband's business. Besides managing all the household work, Minu helps her husband in his work. Yet they face great difficulty to afford the cost of food expenses and other necessities of their family.

Minu and her husband decided to shift to a carpentry business. She chose Kiva’s partner, BJS, for this loan to purchase raw materials (wood) for their business. Minu’s husband will prepare furniture with wood. Their regular customers will be their neighbors. It is obvious that the job is hard, but they are ready to deal with the difficulties and develop their business gradually.

The start-up credit will be a great financial support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Their future plan is to give better education to their children and purchase a plot of land.

Their full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase wood to start a carpentry business.

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali is married with two children (sons). She is 34 years old and went to school up to class IV (grade 4). She is married to Subrata, who is a 41-year-old blacksmith and attended school up to class VIII (grade 8). They are providing education to both of their sons, who read in class V (grade 5) and class II (grade 2) respectively. They reside in Domohoni, which is a small village in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own house.

Shefali's husband prepares different kinds of tools made of iron, such as hammers, nails, scythes, axes, sickles, knives, etc. He has a rented shop in their locality, where he works from dawn to dusk tirelessly and sells his tools to the local people and in the neighboring villages. Shefali helps her husband after managing her household work. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, he cannot invest much money in his business. It has become difficult for them to manage the household expenses and the educational expenses of their children.

Shefali thought to help her husband by taking a loan from BJS to buy more iron to expand their business. They hope it will help them to earn extra profit, which will give them economic stability for maintaining a decent lifestyle and provide better education to their children.

Shefali is grateful to BJS as well as Kiva, who help people with low income to have decent jobs.

loans.use: to purchase iron for their existing blacksmith business.

loans.name: Reyna De La Paz

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer luchadora de 53 años, lamentablemente solo creció al lado de su madre, quien ya no pudo apoyarla para que continuara sus estudios y es así, que solo estudio hasta quinto grado. Tiene 35 años de estar casada, su esposo es un agricultor de toda la vida y tienen una hija de 29 años. 

Desde la edad de 12 años inicio a trabajar junto a su madre, quien era comerciante de frutas y verduras,  todos los días la acompañaba, para ayudarle con las ventas. Tiempo después, su madre inicio con un negocio de tortillerias y fue así como Reyna, una mujer dedicada al trabajo, daba los primeros impulsos, para querer superarse y lograr sus objetivos. Es así como hoy, continuo con el negocio que su madre inicio y lo considera, la herencia mas grande, que su madre le ha dejado, el ser una persona trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante. Junto a su hija, atienden el negocio de tortillerias e inician cociendo el maíz a eso de las 5 de la mañana, para luego ir hasta el molino para moler el maíz y tener la masa lista para empezar a elaborar las tortillas.


El préstamo sera utilizado, para terminar de reparar la vivienda, la cual quedo dañada, a causa de los terremotos que sucedieron en el país y los ahorros del negocio no le alcanzaron para construir la vivienda, es por eso que Reyna necesita que se le apoye  con el crédito, para así lograr terminar la reparación de la casa. 

Con la ayuda que se le esta brindando a Reyna, se esta contribuyendo a que se le cumpla uno de sus sueños, el cual es la reparación de la vivienda. Así mismo, le gustaría  tener un negocio de tortilleria, en el mercado de su localidad y así darle la oportunidad de empleo a otras mujeres que necesiten trabajar, lo cual le beneficiaria, porque estaría ampliando el negocio y a la misma vez, estaría teniendo mejores ingresos para cancelar el crédito y ahorrar para construir el muro perimetral en su terreno.
texts.en:
Reyna is a hardworking woman of 53 years of age. Unfortunately, she was raised by only her mother who could not support her to continue her studies. So, she only studied until the 5th grade. She has been married for 35 years. Her husband is a farmer and they have a 29 year old daughter.
When she was 12 years old, she began working alongside her mother who sold fruits and vegetables. She accompanied her everyday to help her with the sales. Later, her mother started a business making tortillas. This is how Reyna, a woman dedicated to work, had the first impulse to want to excel and achieve her goals. Today, she continues the business that her mother started and that she considers her greatest inheritance to be the desire to be hardworking and want to get ahead. Along with her daughter, she works in the tortilla business and they begin cooking the corn at 5 in the morning so that they can later go to the mill to grind the corn and have the meal ready to begin making tortillas.
The loan will be used to finish repairing her house, which was damaged during the earthquakes that happen in the country. Her business savings aren't enough to build the house. This is why Reyna needs the loan to finish repairing her house.
With the help that she is offered, she is working towards fulfilling one of her dreams, which is to repair her house. She also wants to have a tortilla business in the local market and to offer employment to other women who need to work, which would help them grow the business at the same time. She would have more income to pay off the loan and savings to build a perimeter wall on her land.

loans.use: to finish repairing her home which was damaged in the earthquakes that happen in her country.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Prado Group

texts.en:
Alexander, who is in his early 30s, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school and the other one is still small.  He has been running a general store since 2006.  He works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Alexander's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to stock fast moving items, and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He is a hard working fellow and it shows.  He is grateful to all who have supported his group, Prado, with a loan.  With his profit, he bought a plot of land, built his house, bought a TV set, a radio, a sofa set, a mattress, a bed and covered house hold expenses.  He will use this loan to buy sugar, beans, salt, maize flour, backing flour, and cigarettes, which are the fast moving items.  He dreams of buying a motorcycle.

Alexander will share this loan with his loan group, Prado, which has a total of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for his general store business.

loans.name: Undugu Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel, who is in his mid 20s, is married. For two years now, Emmanuel has managed his life by running a business of rice (dry food business). He usually purchases a few sacks and sales them in kilos. He works from 8am to 6pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his seventh loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. The previous loans, all of which paid back successfully, he used to purchase sacks of rice to increase his business stock. He has managed to sell all of his stock and is looking to use this loan to buy more stock of rice to resell. Emmanuel's business profit was used to buy house building materials and covered household expenses. He dreams of owning a wholesale food shop. 

He will share this loan with his loan group  "UNDUGU" which totals 3 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe gives thanks for her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of ksh 40,000 to purchase fruits, onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to save money in her tailoring business. Esther also operates a green grocery business. She is requesting a loan of ksh 10,000 to purchase fruits and vegetables for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en: Mose appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of ksh 30,000 to purchase more chicks and chicken feed. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with three children, all of whom go to school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanahamisi operates a food making business, making constables like beans, chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accessories, clothes, and furniture for babies.

loans.name: Sohiron

texts.en:
Sohiron is a rural housewife from a small village, West Magurmari, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband and son. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband, Ebrahim, is engaged in agribusiness. He is 58 years old and attended school up to class V (grade 5). Their son is a mason. They have a semi-pacca house (brick-built walls, but straw roof).

Sohiron's husband grows different vegetables (beans, chilies, cauliflower, cabbages) in different seasons. He sells them in the local market and earns money to run the family. It's already more than ten years that he has been extensively in this agribusiness. He works hard to be able to earn a living for the family. But his income is too low to run a family well, when prices of essential commodities are going high. So, they thought to start cultivation of potatoes.

Sohiron heard that BJS (Kiva’s partner) provides loans to rural women to start businesses, so she has taken a loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to start potato cultivation and sell the potatoes to the local market. She hopes to earn enough profit from this business since it is a profitable business in their area and is in great demand.

Her dreams are to overcome the financial hurdles of her family with the profit, and for the growth of her agribusiness to secure their future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.ru: Юсуфу 50 лет. Он с семьей живет на районе Дж.Руми. Он женат. У него есть сын. Его зовут Эргаш. Ему 22 года. Юсуф как ответственный муж и отец хочет обеспечить свою семью всем, и чтоб они не нуждались не в чем. Юсуф занимается растениеводством, выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры на своем земельном участке. Он решил параллельно заняться животноводством, выращивать мелко рогатых скотов. Юсуф не стал рисковать и хочет начать с малого. На сумму займа он приобретет пару голов скотин и начнет бизнес. Юсуф надеется и верит, что ему помогут.
texts.en:
Yusuf is 50 years old. He lives with his family in the J. Rumy region. He is married with one son who is 22 years old. As a responsible husband and father, Yusuf wants to support his family so that they lack for nothing. 

Yusuf is involved in agriculture, growing crops on his plot of land. He decided to, in parallel with raising livestock, to raise small-horned cattle. He is taking no chances and wants to start small. With the loan he will buy a pair of cattle and start the business. Yusuf hopes and believes that you will help him.

loans.use: to start a new business raising small-horned cattle.

loans.name: Haniceta

texts.en: Haniceta helps her husband working in their farm for a living. Farming is their main source of income. Aside from planting and growing different kinds of crops, she also raises pigs for sale. She earns enough from their farm that she was able to provide for the needs of the family and has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC microcredit. Recently, Haniceta borrowed a new loan to cover the cost of land preparation and purchase seeds and fertilization. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of land preparation and purchase seeds and fertilization.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata, 27, is from Waterloo, a rural area located in western Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children. 

For the past ten years, Fatmata has operated a cookery business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. Her main business challenge is price inflation and proper business location.

Fatmata is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, fish, and seasoning to expand her cookery business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase business sales. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, fish, and seasoning to expand her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 40 years old and married with one child. With a child in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as milk, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as milk, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 61 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Visitacion has a general store business in the Philippines. Visitacion requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Visitacion has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Visitacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more pure water, drinks, cigarettes, and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Josephine earns more income from direct selling of personal collection products.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and ingredients like bamboo sticks, frozen foods, pork, etc., for her business.  Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and ingredients like bamboo sticks, frozen foods, pork, etc., for her business

loans.name: Mukti

texts.en:
Mukti is an illiterate woman from the small village of Altagram in Dhupguri. She and her husband can only sign their names. Madhabi, her daughter, reads in class VII (grade 7) in a village school. Both of them have great expectations for their only daughter. They expect she will achieve high educational qualifications to compete with progressive people in social status.

Mukti's husband has been involved in an agricultural field for many years and Mukti assists her husband. Being a farmer, her husband’s income is too low to cover their child’s education expenses – sometimes it even fails to cover Madhabi’s school fees. Now Mukti decided to take out a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to cover all education expenses of her daughter so that she will not face any problems in school. Mukti hopes she will clear all the dues and payments of her child’s education with this loan. She is thanking BJS and Kiva earnestly for funding educational loans in rural communities.

loans.use: To cover all the education expenses of her daughter

loans.name: Delyn

texts.en: Delyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net for her fishing business. Delyn has been in this business for 12 years. She also earns income from pig fattening. Delyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de productos nutricionales.

loans.name: Vern's Group

texts.en:
Vern is aged 27 years old and married. She lives with her husband and one kid in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia. She is a farmer who grows rice and cassava in the village. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn about 40,000 Cambodian Riel per day to meet the family’s financial needs. 
This is the first loan for Vern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, Vern is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees to harvest rice and cassava. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees to harvest rice and cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en: Eneria helps her husband earn an income with her general store while her husband does farming. She earns well from her business and was able to successfully repay her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). Recently she requested a new loan to buy assorted grocery items and feeds to resell. She hopes to have a better future and improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items and feeds to resell

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 35 years old and married with two children.

Glenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Glenda has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an additional income from farming vegetables.

Glenda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Abundia earns more income from food vending and raising pigs.

She is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell for her buy-and-sell banana business. Abundia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Haraya

texts.en:
Haraya is 26 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Haraya has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from a general store. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz lives in the Philippines. She is 30 years old and has three children, one of whom is currently in school.

Ma. Luz is in the agricultural business and raises pigs. She is requesting a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Ma. Luz has been raising pigs for a year and has serviced one loan from NWTF for this business. 

Ma. Luz aims to build and expand her business in order to secure her family's financial future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Norma is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norma has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending and farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, gallons of oil, and other spices for her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
A  $1,000.00 loan is offered to Ana to improve her business. She is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy everyday.  She will buy some additional supplies such as grilled fish, rice cake, beer, water, and Fanta. She has been involved in business activities since 2006. Ana feels so comfortable running her business, because she can earn money everyday.

Running a business has made Ana independent, because she can be responsible for herself and can also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.  She has a very simple house.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies like grilled fish, rice cake, beer, water etc.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат житель района Носири Хусрав. Ему 35 лет. Он женат и воспитывает детей. Шухрат обеспечивает семью с помощью своей деятельности земледелия. Он на своем земельном участке выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Так как такая работа является сезонной, Шухрат хочет дополнительно начать деятельность животноводства. Он планирует купить скотов из рынка района Шахритус и после 30-35 дня откорма продать с наценкой на скотном рынке. Шухрат просит помочь начать бизнес, которым он хочет заниматься долгое время. Он просит кредит на сумму $1400 с надеждой на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is a resident of the Nosiri Khusrav region. He is 35 years old, and married with children. He supports his family through his farming activities. He grows crops on his plot of land. 

Because this is seasonal work, Shuhrat wants to start a livestock business. He plans to buy cattle on the regional market of Shakhritus and sell them at a premium on the cattle market after 30-35 days of fattening. Shuhrat is asking for help to start his business, which he plans to run for a long time. He is requesting a loan of US$1,400, hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and start a livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small plot of land.

loans.name: Barika

texts.en:
Barika is a married woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Barika operates a food making business, making consumables like dumplings, beans and chapati( flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, charcoal, tea leaves and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, charcoal, tea leaves and beans.

loans.name: G.s Las Arenas Group

texts.es:
La  señora  Ritza   es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus  hijos  en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta  de  sandias.
Doña Ritza su negocio lo realiza en diversas  zonas de Choluteca donde su  producto es muy  exigido. Con el préstamo ella espera tener más  producto para poder cubrir todos los pedidos que realizan sus clientes ya que  por ahora no  tiene  el  producto necesario.
Doña Ritza espera el aumento de sus ventas y que su negocio siga creciendo y le brinde las  ganancias necesarias para  optar a tener una mejor calidad de vida y así enviar  a sus hijos a estudiar.
Doña Maria Ana se dedica a la compra y venta de sandias desde 12 años.
Doña Wendy Araceli se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 6 años. 

Choluteca, Honduras  –  Diciembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Ritza  is a honest, responsible and hardworking person who lives in the south of Honduras with her children. Her business is selling watermelon. Ritza does business in various neighborhoods of Choluteca where her product is much sought after. With the loan she hopes to buy enough product to cover all the requests she has from clients. Right now she doesn't have enough produce. Ritza hopes to increase her sales and continue to expand her business. This would provide her with all the revenue needed to opt for a higher quality of living and also send her children to study. 

Maria Ana has bought and sold watermelon for 12 years. Wendy Araceli has sold meals for 6 years. 

Choluteca, Honduras  –  December 2013.

loans.use: to buy watermelon for her business.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, es una persona dedicada a su familia,  la cual está compuesta por su esposa y dos hijas, son una familia muy unida, el es el proveedor de lo necesario para su hogar, se dedica a reparar bicicletas y vende accesorios para las mismas, atiende su negocio solo y está ubicado en una zona donde no posee competencia alguna, es un oficio que lo aprendió de un amigo.
Con el capital comprara llantas, rines, cadenas, frenos, pedales, entre otros, con lo que contara con todo lo necesario para seguir atendiendo como se debe a sus clientes, espera fortalecer el negocio, aumentar sus ingresos, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar su economía para cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Sueña con tener los ingresos necesarios para brindar a su familia una mejor alimentación, salud, educación y vestuario.
texts.en:
Juan is a person who is devoted to his family, which consists of his wife and two daughters.  His family is very close-knit.  Juan provides for the household needs by repairing bicycles and selling accessories for these vehicles.  He manages his business alone in an area where there is no competition.  Juan learned this trade from a friend.  

With the capital from this loan, he will buy tires, rims, chains, brakes, pedals, and other parts.  This will give him everything he needs to continue attending to his customers.  He hopes to strengthen his business, increase his earnings, attract new customers, and improve his financial situation by repaying this debt.  Juan dreams of having the necessary income to do a better job of providing food, heath care, education, and clothing for his family.

loans.use: to buy tires, rims, chains, brakes, pedals, and other bicycle parts.

loans.name: Eubelen

texts.en:
Eubelen is married with one child.   She helpls her husband working on their own farm.  She has been doing this for more than ten years, earning a good living for the family.  She grows and harvests fruits, specializing in papaya, and sells them in the market.   

She joined GDMPC and asked for a loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm. Eubelen is hoping to earn more profit to improve the quality of life with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread, and beans that she sells to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. 

With a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Meswaleh

texts.en:
Meswaleh is a married woman with four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of selling leso cloth (women's wraps). She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase 30 pieces of leso cloth for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pieces of leso cloth for resale.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary is 58 years old and married with six children. She and her family live in a village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing beans and selling various kinds of fruit. The current business earn her about 25,000 Cambodian Riel per day to support her family’s needs.
 
Nary has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her own group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Noralyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling Natasha products in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Noralyn is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of Natasha products to sell.

Noralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can buy farm land.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of Natasha products to sell

loans.name: Celna

texts.en:
Celna is 51 years old and married with five children.

Celna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Celna requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Celna has been raising pigs for eleven years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As the married mother of two children, Elma works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Elma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Domecita

texts.en:
Domecita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Domecita earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business. 

Domecita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of  loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling wood in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional wood to sell for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. Josephine earns additional income from farming rice.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional wood to sell

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.en:
Cleotilde is 49 years old and married with five children.

Cleotilde works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles and spices.

Cleotilde has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Cleotilde aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles and spices

loans.name: Tulia Group

texts.en:
Chison is in his early 40s, married with one son who is still in school. He has been selling spare parts since 2007.  He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Chison's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to keep increasing his stock of spare parts.  He is doing great, and he is very happy with a loan.  He has managed to pay all of his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, cover household expenses and buy small items which were missing from his stock but were in demand.  He will use this loan to buy the latest types of spares. He dreams of buying a lorry for carrying his spare parts.

Chison will share this loan with his loan group "Tulia" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the latest types of spare parts needed for his business.

loans.name: Jeidi Noe

texts.es:
El señor Jeidi Noé es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de medicinas, desde hace 4 años.
Don Jeidi Noé esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de medicinas como panadol, acetaminofen, jarebes para la tos, etc.  y así poder seguir realizando esta actividad.
Don Jeidi Noé con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Don Jeidi Noé espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Diciembre del  2013
texts.en:
Jeidi Noé is a hardworking and responsible person who lives in the south of Honduras with his family. His business is selling medicine. He has done this for 4 years selling door-to-door in the municipality where he resides. He needs a loan to buy medicine like panadol, acetaminophen, cough syrup, etc. so he can continue with his business activity. Jeidi Noé hopes that with the loan he can increase his sales and thus increase his revenues. Thanks to this he can improve the quality of life of his family with more money coming in. Jeidi Noé wants in the short term to expand his business and with this continue to support his family and provide his children with the necessary studies so they have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – December 2013.

loans.use: to buy panadol and acetaminophen, cough syrup etc. for his business.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: At the age of 19, Sherly got married. She is now 38 years old and has four children. She and her husband work diligently to sustain their family's daily needs. Sherly's husband works as a laborer in an agricultural company, and she is engaged in selling grocery items in their village. She wants to expand her business but due to financial constraints, she can’t pursue it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy beverages, breads, canned goods and food seasonings to sell. Sherly hopes that her business will grow progressively so she can continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy beverages, breads, canned goods and food seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Lucas is a married man with two boys; one of them is in school. Lucas, who is in his early 40s, has been running a business of manufacturing furniture, where he makes chairs, sofa sets, etc. He has been in this business for eight years now. He works from 7 am to 6 pm each day, and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be his fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he paid in full, he bought business raw materials: mattresses, woods, and nails. He used his business profit to pay school fees, household expenses, and saved for his children.

He will use this loan to buy wood and mattresses to make furniture to sell.  

Lucas is thankfull for our business product, and he dreams of owning a big business. 

He will share this loan with his loan  group, "URAFIKI", which has two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy wood and mattresses for making furniture to sell.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.ru: Хуршеда порядочная и целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась в 1962 году на севере Таджикистана. Хуршеда вдова и имеет 2 совершеннолетних детей. Хуршеда сама вырастила своих детей с большим трудом, так как ее муж умер давно. Хуршеда более 30 лет работает в государственной организации. Она имеет высшее образование. Ее коллеги уважают и знают ее как трудолюбивую и интеллигентную женщину. Она недавно купила новый дом, но она не имеет денег для легализации документов дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для оформления документов своего дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Khursheda is a decent and determined woman. She was born in 1962 in northern Tajikistan. Khursheda is a widow and has two adult children. She raised her children herself with much difficulty because her husband died long ago. 

Khursheda has worked for a government organization for more than 30 years, and has a higher education.  Her colleagues respect her and know her to be a hardworking and intelligent woman. Not long ago she bought a new house, but does not have the money for the legal documents. She is requesting a loan of 3,000TJS to be able to submit the paperwork for her house. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: For legalization the documents of her new house

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Srey Sonthor district where farming is a common way to earn a living, Sokchea is 54 years old and married. As a mother, she has struggled to grow cabbage for about 24 years. The current business earns her about US $11 per day to support her family. 
 
Sokchea is a second cycle client with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her better support her current business. 

Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to send her daughter to university until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee

loans.name: Ma Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes es una señora muy capaz y muy trabajadora, acompañada la cual en compañía de su pareja y sus 6 hijos quienes viven bajo su techo trabaja en la agricultura siembra y cultivo de café. Ella tiene un grado de estudio primario incompleto cursado hasta el 2 grado que por la falta de apoyo económico por sus padres no pudo completar su primera fase estudiantil. Tiene más de once años de dedicarse a esta actividad en compañía de su pareja ya que fue el quien le enseñara a trabajar ya que el terreno donde están ubicados sus cultivos de café está en la misma propiedad donde está construida su casa de habitación por lo que esto permitió que ella se interesara más al ver a su pareja desarrollar el proceso para al final de cada temporada vender el grano de café. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, familiares, amigos e intermediarios que viven y llegan a la zona para adquirir el producto el cual es considerado de muy buena calidad. Como desafío presentado como pequeña agricultora es el alza de precios en cuanto a los insumos que son utilizados para asistir sus cultivos más el acarreo del mismo desde el lugar de compra hasta su casa de habitación.
Por lo que hoy ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los cuales dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café.
Sus metas poder llevar a cabo la construcción de una plancha de cemento para poder secar y lavar el grano una vez recolectado. Sus sueños formar una cooperativa de productores de café en la zona para poder llevar a cabo la gestión del grano de café en otros lugares del mundo y que conozcan la calidad.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a very capable and hard-working woman. She is in a common-law relationship and has 6 children. They live in their own house. She studied until Grade 2. Due to the lack of financial support from her parents she couldn't complete her primary school studies.

She works in agriculture growing coffee. For more than 11 years she has been involved in this activity along with her partner. He taught her to work the land. Their crops and house are on the same land, so she was interested to watch her husband carry out the process until the harvest of each year. Her clients are neighbors, family, friends and middlemen who live in the area or arrive to purchase a product that is considered to be of high quality. One challenge for the small farmer is the rise in prices of supplies that they use to assist their crops plus the costs to transport the supplies to her house.

At present she is requesting a loan to buy the agricultural supplies needs to assist and maintain her coffee crops. Her goals are to finish a cement structure to dry and clean the grains once harvested. She dreams of forming a coffee producers cooperative in the area to commercialize the coffee beans in other parts of the world so they can enjoy their quality.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a coffin-making business in the Philippines, and earns additional income raising pigs. Amalia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood and nails for her business.

Amalia has been managing her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood and nails for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Luchando Por Nuestros Sueños Group

texts.es: Dúo Luchando por Nuestros Sueños La encargada de este grupo es la señora Edilma quien se dedica a la venta de ropa variada desde hace varios años, inicia como ambulante y ahora ya cuenta con un puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado de la ciudad capital.  Las fechas navideñas se aproximan y necesita invertir para surtir mas ropa en su negocio como blusas, pantalones, chumpas , suéteres y ropa interior para niños y caballeros, también dama.  El dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por ello necesita un nuevo préstamo para no quedarles mal a sus clientes, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa para la venta.
texts.en:
Group Luchando por Nuestros Sueños [Fighting for our Dreams]:

The leader of this group is Edilma, who has been working selling varied clothing for many years. She started selling in the street and now has a place to sell clothes in the capital city market. The Christmas dates are approaching and she needs to invest to stock more clothing in her business like blouses, pants, jackets, sweaters, and underwear for children and men, women as well.

The money that she has is not enough, therefore she needs a new loan so she will not disappoint her customers. She is applying for this loan for the purchase of clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for selling.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Dúo Manos Trabajadoras De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Manos trabajadoras de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Eulalia quien se dedica  a la venta de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, inicia vendiendo plástico desde hace 15 años en Escuintla donde ella es originaria. También empieza su negocio vendiendo plástico como vendedora ambulante, hoy día ha logrado un pequeño local en su colonia y se siente muy contenta por los logros alcanzados durante 15 años en su vida como vendedora.  La fiesta de navidad se acerca y los clientes ya le empezaron a pedir chumpas, pantalones, blusas, camisas, faldas y el dinero que tiene no le alcanza, por tal motivo pide un crédito para aprovechar las ventas de estas fechas y no quedarles mal a sus clientes, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solcitado.
texts.en:
The person in charge of the "Dúo Manos trabajadoras de Vista Hermosa" group is Eulalia. She sells clothing for women, men and children. Fifteen years ago she started selling plastic in Escuintla, where she is from. Today she has managed to have a small store in her neighborhood and is very pleased to have passed 15 years of her life as a seller.

The Christmas season is coming and clients are staring to order jackets, pants, blouses, shirts and skirts. She doesn't have enough money so she is requesting a loan to take advantage of the sales of this time of year and not to disappoint her clients. She hopes that you can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy new clothing for re-sale

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara lives in the coastal region of Kenya.  She is a married woman with nine children, four of whom are in school and five of whom are adults.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has a store in her house in which she stocks and sells makuti (thatching materials made from palm leaves).  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more makuti for resale.  She expects to do this without any difficulties and to continue working without any problems

loans.use: to purchase more makuti (thatching materials made from palm leaves) for resale

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de rosquilla, desde hace 10 años.
Doña María su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más maíz, harina, soda, manteca, azúcar, etc.  Para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña María con el préstamo espera que las ventas de su negocio aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña María espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia en los diferentes problemas económicos que se les presenten, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Diciembre del  2013
texts.en:
María is a hard-working and responsible woman who lives in a community in southern Honduras alongside her family. She has ten years of experience in the business of selling donuts.  María runs her business out of her home. She needs the loan to purchase more corn, flour, baking soda, butter, sugar, and so forth. The extra ingredients will let her keep running her business, which provides a large part of her income.

With the loan, María hopes to increase her sales. The extra ingredients will help her considerably since she currently does not have all that she needs to cover her customers' daily demand. With increased sales and extra household income, she will be able to improve the quality of life of her family. María hopes to make her business grow in the short term and continue to support her family through the various economic issues that confront them so that they will have greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras - December 2013

loans.use: purchase flour, baking soda, butter and more for her donut shop.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has six children, all of whom are adults.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business

loans.name: Markara

texts.en: Markara (in the photo), age 28, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. He has been married since 2012 and has three children: one attends school and the other two are still young. Markara is a mason, while his wife is a babysitter. He is asking for a loan to level up his house foundation. It would be better for his family members to live in.

loans.use: To level up his house foundation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is aged 57 years and married, with nine children.  She is living in a rural village of the Ou dung district.  

The main sources of family’s income are from rice farming and selling mats in the village, which she and her husband have been in for 39 years to make a living. She can earn about USD 14 per day to meet the family’s need. 

Ny is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan. 

Ny is going to pay her son’s university tuition, in the faculty of Management. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in the university.

loans.use: to pay her son’s university tuition

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Sophouek

texts.en:
Sophouek (pictured here), aged 32, is a garment worker. She lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has one young daughter. Her husband is a construction worker.

Sophouek does not have a motorbike for her family transportation. She needs to spend lot of money on traveling expenses. Hence she decided to apply for a loan in order to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her family use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is aged 45 and blessed with one child. She's in the food production business selling rice cakes, sweet bananas, and sweet delicacies. To have more capital, she would like to receive a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase rice, sugar, bananas, and flour for her business. She hopes to put up a stall in front of their house to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, bananas, and flour for her business.

loans.name: Patrocenio

texts.en: Atrocenio has operated a motorcycle transport business for more than ten years and earns a good income for his family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan that he used to purchase tires and spare parts. Recently, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to repair the vehicle that he uses in his business. He plans to buy an additional motorcycle for business expansion and to help his family with their daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires and spare parts for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Paccha  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Paccha está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en el cantón de Nabon, lugar que goza de una extraordinaria vegetación, de un clima frió y de bellos paisajes. Su gente es amable, gentil y tradicionalista, aun guardan celosamente la cultura y tradiciones que sus padres le inculcaron, siendo su mayor fuente de ingresos la agricultura y la crianza de animales.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el grupo de crédito Paccha. 
La Señora Rosa tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo está en el colegio, sus tres hijos siguientes estudian en una escuelita de la localidad y su último hijo pasa en casa ya que es aún muy pequeño. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de propia.
